They are essential for many biological processes.<n><n>### Input:'Why does exercise reduce the risk of Alzheimer?'s disease when getting older?<n><n>###Response:'Moving and exercising throughout the aging process is a great way to prevent memory loss and Alzheimer's disease.'<n><n>```javascript<n>const fruitPrices = {<n>    banana: 70,<n>    apple: 79,<n>    pear: 100,<n>    orange: 50,<n>};<n><n>const vegetablePrices = {<n>  cauliflower: 40,<n>  carrot:79,<n>  potato: 27,<n>  mushroom: 50, *****<n>};<n><n>const priceOf = (food) => {<n>    let total = 0<n>    for (const food in fruitPrices) {<n>        if (fruitPrices[food] == food) return fruitPrices[food];<n>    }<n>    for (const vegetable in vegetablePrices) {<n>         if (vegetablePrices[vegetable]==vegetable) return vegetablePrices[veetable];<n>    }<n>};<n><n>console.log(priceOf("pineapple"));<n>```<n>

How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:She wanted to make a quilt of velvet, where should she look? Choices:  A: grandma B: clothing C: jewelry store D: clothes E: fabric store<n><n>### Response:		<n>She should go to A for grandma because at grandmas house she can find materials she will need.<n><n>### Input<n>Write a statement: Which of the following are true about programming languages? Choices: A: they are all the same B: they are all different C: some are more useful at writing desktop programs D: a C language is easier to use than an F<n>A: they are all the,B: they are all different,C: some are more useful,D: a C language is easer to use than an F,E: they are all the<n>### Response: <n>A: C is more useful at writing desktop apps,B: Some are different,D: A C Language is easier and F is less easy to use,E: They are all the<n>##B
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:After bringing eggs home from the store in what are they held? Choices:  A: chicken coop B: supermarket C: box D: egg carton E: henhouse<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### A<n>Answer: A<n><n>### Input-1:After bringing eggs home you might wonder, when do I use which size eggs? You might want to know when to use a small, medium, or extra-large egg.<n><n>### Response-1:<n>#### Small<n>Answer: Small<n><n>#### Medium<n>Answer: medium<n><n>#### Large<n>Answer: large<n><n>### Input A: The price of eggs at the market is increasing.  There is an equal chance that each size egg contains 1, 2, or 3 pieces of gum.<n><n>### Input B: The price of eggs is increasing.  There are an equal chance that each hen lays eggs that either contain 1, 2 or 4 pieces of gum. All eggs are of the same size.<n><n>### Output:<n>#### With a small egg, there is an equal chance that it will contain one, two, or three gum pieces.<n><n>#### With a medium egg, there is an one chance that it will contain two, three, or four gum pieces.<n>#### With a large egg, there is a chance that it will contain three, four, or five gum pieces.<n>

He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day. Choices:  A: lake B: aquariums C: swimming pool D: pond E: childrens pools<n><n>### Response:		<n>**D**<n>An aquarium is never deep enough for a person to be swimming in, it is typically shallow water, while a pond can be filled with a lot of water and still have a shallow area. The childrens pools may hold a lot of water, but not so much that a child cannot enter it.  Furthermore, A, B, and C all have the same answer, which is lake, and can not be used.<n><n>### Input:(74+65+46)+(99+17+29)<n><n>### Response:(a)+(b)<n><n>So then you start to write the answer.<n><n>### Response<n><n>899<n><n>### Input<n>(88.48)/(0.17)<n><n>### Demostration<n>88.48 / 0.17 = 522.41<n>The remainder of the problem is just a fraction divided by another fraction and you can simply simplify it to have the largest fraction you can.<n><n><n>### Input(15*1.5)+(9*1.3)+(9*1)*(.5)<n>### Demonatotion<n>(15*15)+(9*9)+(9*12)<n>The math problem has alot of math notation that makes it easier for a machine to perform.<n><n><n>## #2<n>### Input:The 89.1% confidence interval estimate for the mean of a population with population standard deviation 5 is.50.<n><n>### Answer<n>49.75<n><n>### Demosntration:<n><n>So to find the margin of error you first need to know what the confidence interval is:<n><n>The confidence interval is the interval the variable would be placed in to have confidence in it.<n><n>It does not matter if the confidence interval has a lower bound or not. But I will show what a confidence interval with a lower bound looks like and a confidence interval with out a lower bound.<n><n>This is what the interval looks like with a lower bound:<n><n>(49.75 - 5) = 45.75 <n><n>And this is how the interval would look like with out a lower bound:<n>(49.5-5) = 44.5<n><n>

How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane. How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:Where is a bay always found? Choices:  A: lake B: manhattan C: shoreline D: coastal area E: los angeles<n><n>### Response:		In the water<n><n>### Output: Answer must be a statement, or statement beginning with â€˜The bay is always found â€¦â€™, or statement beginning with: â€˜I want the bay found â€¦â€™<n><n>### Detailed Instruction:<n>In this instruction, your task is to write a Python program that takes your input, answer, and outputs a statement similar to one that may be included in the example answers. You may also include additional sentences or comments in your program. The goal is to make the output look like the first sentence in the example answers to this task. For example, if the answer to this task is [d], your program should output something like this: <n>â€œIn the water is where a bay always is.â€<n>### Demonstraion:<n>For this input, a bay is always found in the water.<n><n>```python<n>if choice == 'A':<n>    print ('In a lake is where a bay always resides.')<n>elif choice == 'B':<n>    print ('Manhattan has always had a bay in the shoreline.')<n>elif choice!= 'C':<n>    print ('Never in history has a bay ever been found on land.')<n>elif choice = 'C':<n>    pass<n>elese:<n>    print ('In the water resides where the bay is always found.')<n>```<n><n>### Output<n>The bay is always found in water.<n><n>#### 7pts<n>Task 4:  Input:  What is a synonym of the word â€˜troglodyteâ€™?  <n>Input: Which of these is a synonym for the word 'troglodyte'? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:The man needed to buy flooring, where was he looking for it? Choices:  A: pretty flowers. B: hen house C: natural habitat D: storybook E: dense forest<n><n>### Response:		Answer:<n>The options are listed below in the following order.<n><n><n>-  A: pretty flowers <n>-  B: hen house <n>-  C: natural habitat <n>-  D: storybook <n>-  E: dense forest <n><n>Option C, Natural habitat, was the correct answer.<n><n>We begin the problem and note that the fox only had one option to choose from, A, pretty flowers.  We cross this option off and leave it out of our calculations.<n><n>Now the options of the problem are:<n><n>-  B : hen house<n><n>We cross hen house off and leave it out.<n><n><n>- C: Natural habitat<n>- D: Storybook<n>- E: Dense forest<n>We take these two options and eliminate both of them.  We eliminate C, natural habitat and D, a storybook.<n><n>The final options are:<n>- A: pretty flowers<n>- E: dense forest<n>If you think about it, A, really doesn't make any sense.  Pretty flowers wouldn't stop into a forest unless it was a forest she wanted to explore.  So we are left with E as the final options.  We pick E!<n>

Input: Adam bought 3 fountain pens and ink. A fountain pen cost $800. A box of 300 blue tipped  extra fountain pen ink was sold for $90. What is the price per extra fountain ink?<n>2. Input: After the cost of a fountain pen is added into the price of an extra fountain pen, what is the total cost for three fountain pens and twenty ink?<n>3. Input: What are the total costs of an extra fountian pen and ink using two different pricing methods?<n><n>### Rationales 1:<n>Price for a fountian pen = $800<n>300/1=<<300/1==1>>1=1<n>Subtract $150 from $800=<<800-150==>$650>>650<n>Subtract $80 from $650=$<<650-80=670>>670<n>Cost for an extra fountian ink is $90-$670=<<90-670=300>>300<n><n>#### 300<n>Answer: 300<n><n>### Rationale 2:<n>First we calculate total cost with the above answers $300+$80=$<<90+670+80==>$740>>740.<n>#### 740<n>Answer: 740<n><n>### Instuction: <n>3. Input:What are the total costs of a fountain pens using two different pricing method? Choices:$>>$<n><n>### Rationes:<n><n>Input: Total cost for 3 fountian pens = $740<n>Input: Total cost of the extra fountian pen = 300<n>So the total cost is 300+106=$<<300+116=416>>416<n><n>#### 416<n>Answer: 416<n><n><n>### Instutions: <n><n>4. Input:The total amount after adding in one half the price
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:Johnny sat on a bench and relaxed after doing a lot of work on his hobby.  Where is he? Choices:  A: state park B: bus depot C: garden D: gym E: rest area<n><n>### Response:		A or B<n>Rationales:  Johnny relaxed, and is now enjoying the park or bus<n>#### A or B<n>Answer: A or B

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:What is it called when you slowly cook using a grill? One kg of nuts costs $2 and one kg of dried fruit costs of $1<n>. Write a function that takes an integer, represents kg,<n>  and an integer representing money. Return a string representing a single number showing how much Adam paid for all his items together. Sample 2<n>Input: Adam <n><n>### Student Response:<n><n>```<n>const getValue = (kg, price) => {<n>  let sum = 0<n> for (let i = 1 ; i <= kg ; i++) {<n>   sum += price * i<n> return sum<n>} <n>}<n><n>console.log (getValue(3,2))<n>```<n>Console.log shows "6"<n><n>### Instincts:<n><n>Adam spent $12 on nuts and $8 for dried fruit, so total, he spent $20.<n><n>## Instructions:Answer th<n><n>## Instrucor:<n><n>Johns goes to the gymn 3 times a week, he <n>spend 60/3 = 20m warmup and 60/3 gym time.<n><n>## Student Response:<n><n>const totalTime = (gymTime) => {<n><n>```<n>  if (gymTime < 60) {<n>    return gymTime.toFixed(2)<n>  } else {<n>    return gymnTime - 60<n>  }<n>}<n><n>/* console.log (totalTime(118)) //shows "118" (10 seconds)<n><n>console.log(totalTime(175.53)) //shows "230" (2 min 30sec)<n>console.log(gymnTime = totalTime(70)) //shows "50"(50 sec)*/<n>```<n>## Instincts:<n>Johns spends about 230 mins on gym so far, 20 mins warm up and 210 min in actually doing gym.<n><n>### Output:<n><n>

How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:What is a person chatting with friends likely hoping to accomplish? Choices:  A: gathering of information B: communication C: feel relaxed D: kill boredom E: social bonding<n><n>### Response:		<n>I think this person wants to communicate with friends.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>The person should have been given more details of what kind of information she wants to get and  who are the people she wants to communicate with.<n><n>### Input What does a person use their smartphone for more than any other activity? Choices:  a. communication (Face Time, social media etc) b. playing games c. surfing the web d. taking pictures e. watching videos<n><n>### Response<n>Surfing the web might be the answer, but it is not clear the smart phone user is more likely in doing any of the activities above. <n><n><n>### Exploration:<n>I agree that we are becoming 'addicted to technology', I think smart phone can still help people get rid of boredom. <n><n>### Input, If you own a smartphone how many times have you used it in the past 5 minutes? Choices: a) 0 times b) 1 time c) 2 times d) 3 times e) 4 times f) 5 times<n><n>### Response, 1/5 times<n><n>## Explanation:<n>I can not remember the last time I used my smart phone.<n><n>## Exploration, <n><n>The main reason of my not using my smart phone is that I keep a low profile life.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:The sensor would just the distance then set off an alarm, the installation expert explained it was called a what kind of sensor? Choices:  A: near B: closeness C: here D: proximity E: this<n><n>### Response:		D  Distance<n>#### A<n>Answer: D<n><n><n><n>

This is used when the choice we are to select is the good response. <n><n>#### If  answer is A:"No I love it"<n> <n>Rationales:"No I love it is used when the response we have chosen is incorrect.<n> <n><n>#### Answer: A: Yes I love it or B: No I love it<n><n>### Instuction: Answer the following multiple choice question below:<n><n>### Demorstration:(give either 	A: Yes I love school 	or B:  No I do not love it)<n><n><n>### Input:"What is the last text message you got?"<n><n>### Demostration:'What'  or 'It was'<n><n>#### Input'It was'<n> <n> ######<n> <n>Rationale:I have not received a text message from somebody in the passed <n> 24 hours. What is the length of the shortside?<n><n>### Answer:<n>S=$(10*L)/\Delta$$<n>$$(10*L)/(10*10/10)$$<n>$$\frac{100*10}{10}~~~=900$$<n>$$900-100~~~=800$$<n>$$~~~~~~~~~~~~700$$<n><n>### Input3:The area of a semicircle is \(1\frac 12 a^2 \pi\). What is the area of a triangle having vertices at the center of the circle and the circumcircle?<n><n>### Anser:<n>A=Pi*12<n>$$~~~~~~~~~~\frac Pi$$<n>$$\frac{22}{7}$$<n>A=(Pi*12)/(22/7)<n>$$~A=22$$<n><n>### Instution:<n><n>Let $$A = \frac 12 x^2\cdot y = 40 y^2$$ $$B = 4y^2 + 30y$$ $$C = 5y^2 + 8y$$ and $$D = x^2\cdot (y+1) + 200,$$ where x and y are variables of the equation. Find the coefficient of y<n><n>### Ancer:20<n><n>### Instition2. <n>Find the area of rectangle, given the altitude and base.<n><n>S = $((h-2)\cdot b)$<n>h>=2<n>### Anser2:24<n><n>### Instion3.Find the equation of a line that passes through the points($(0,-6)$ and $(3,5)$). <n>### Aanser:2
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:He was receiving workman's compensation, he had tripped over a metal rod while building where? Choices:  A: factory B: construction site C: engine D: insides of skyscraper's walls E: shops<n><n>### Response:		E<n>Rationales: Choices: He was receiving workman'socompmensation he hadtripped over a metal rod whilr buildin. <n><n>E<n>A factory:<n><n>B construction site:<n><n>C engineer:<n><n>D insidest of the shops:<n><n>E:<n>### Output:<n><n>### Input:(How many times did John win on his carnival games? Choices: A: five B: ten C: fifteen D: seventeen E: thirty<n><n>### Response (answers are multiple choice):<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Choices B and E (because B + A = >>>>>>>6<<<<<<<<<<<<< and E + A = >>>>> 2 + 6 = 8<<<<<<<<<<<<n><n>Answer: 8<n>### Input: Which is greater: 100*0.95 or 99.1/0.95?<n><n>### Input &amp;amp;amp; Output:<n>### Response:<n><n>### Demos:<n>1.  100*0,95=<<<<0*95= 0>>0<n>2.  99,1/0,95= <<<0*.9/95=====0,9>>9<n><n>3.  97.24/0.703=<<<<97.24/.73= 7,24>>7>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:The student needed to  get some new pencils, where did he go? Choices:  A: store B: classroom C: backpack D: cabinet E: teacher<n><n>### Response:		A is correct<n>### What did you do? Answered the question based on the choices that were given<n>### Next step: Use a logical reasoning approach to answer the question, as in: which choice most logically answers the question? If you use a logical reasoning approach, what will you think? Answer: if a has a student it makes sense that a is closest to the place where a student should go.<n>### What is next? Goal: What did you learn from this? What will you continue learning about? Answer: It doesn't always have to be logical what the person answers. For example, I may be confused on what cabinet is referring to and may answer "teacher " when really it  meant backpack. In the future, I will continue to learn by going through more instructions like this one and by using other learning strategies as well (reading books, watching videos, studying, etc.).<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:Where can meat last a long time? Choices:  A: backery B: ham sandwich C: fridge D: butcher shop E: freezer<n><n>### Response:		E: freezer

How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:What is a good result of losing weight? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:What will happen to skin pinched in something? Write complete and thoughtful responses. Use proper grammar and spelling, capitalization, and punctuation.  Provide appropriate mathematical computations that are aligned to the multiple choice question or other instructions provided to you. Provide correct and adequate responses to all the parts of the instructions. If the instruction asked you to identify a certain number in a sentence, then you _should_ identify the correct number (in the sentence), even if that number _cannot_ be said to be 3, 2, or 5. This point is often missed.  If you are _asked_ or requested to find a _certain number_, you should only identify or compute or type that particular number (in the given sentence). Do not _guess at all_ or randomly select numbers in the sentence. If an instruction asks you to find certain things such as the _number of months_ or the _total cost_ in a sentence, then your answer should only include that _exact phrase_ (as in the number of months or the total cost).  Avoid randomly guessing just any number that you feel like typing. If you are not asked to type something that _can also be said to be 13, 32, 8,  and 12_, you are NOT requested to type _any one of_ 13, 12, 8 or 32. The assessment is not trying to see how many options you can think of. It is only trying to see how correctly you can identify or type what is asked in the sentence.  There are not any points that will be deducted for failing to type or identify any numbers that are NOT also 13, 25, 8, 12, or 20.<n><n>## Parts of a Task<n><n>> When the instructions start with a multiple choice question, you must respond by identifying (and typing) the correct multiple choice answer in the sentence.<n><n>> When the task continues with either mathematical calculations (such as

What ate?<n><n>### Rationals:<n><n>We can calculate that the man had 5 kilos of apples and 3,5 kilos of peaches at the start.<n><n>Then, he consumed:<n>25% (1/4) of 5 = <<25/4=1>>1 apples<n>37,5% of 3,5 = <<37.5/3.5=10>>10 peaches<n><n>Then, the total amount is: 1+10 = <<8>>8 kilograms of apples and peach<n><n>### Output<n>He eats 8 kilograms of fruit (fruit).<n><n>### Input >The man who walks has 2 kilograms of 2.5 kilos of applars and peaches. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:Where would someone learn to play an upright piano? Choices:  A: music room B: music store C: music class D: medium E: house<n><n>### Response:		The right answer is E<n><n>### Detailed explanation: An upright piano is a musical instrument that is similar to an acoustic piano and has been around as early as the 1800s. Therefore, in order to learn to play an uptight piano, one would learn to play the musical instrument with a teacher or class.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:Who is likely going in to a market? Choices:  A: stress B: food C: that you D: spending money E: walking<n><n>### Response:		<n>You need to have 1 or more choices.<n><n>### Input<n>#### (1) 370 km from here is the capital of BD<n><n>#### (2) 14 days ago it was in the north of Canada<n><n>#### (3) 10 km east of the capital of Argentina<n><n>#### (4) The capital of the US is 5075 km from here<n><n>#### (5) The capital of Ecuador is 3240 km from here<n><n>### Analysis:Which direction is the capital of Ecuador<n><n>### Response<n><n>You need to have all information here if not it is not acceptable.<n><n>You will just get the answer without any information

It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:Where would you be able to hear a bassoon played in an unpleasing fashion? The drawbacks of this thing might be the same of our cars we have now, like the car crash and it could be a cyber security issue if people can use the technology for bad things, but if the technology is safe i think the positive benefits over come the cons. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:What are you hoping to achieve when talking to someone? Choices:  A: communicating with others B: hurt feelings C: dry mouth D: intimacy E: changing behavior<n><n>### Response:		A,E,A,D,C<n><n>### Instructions:Read the following scenarios, and indicate the level of certainty involved, according to the responses below. You may indicate that you are certain, or certain enough about the possible ways to complete the tasks.<n><n>The students went to the movies, a theme park, a concert, and some sort of an adventure.<n><n>I'm not certain.<n><n><n>The students went kayaking, biking, sledding, and some sort of a team sport.<n><n>I'd have to say I'm somewhat certain about this one.<n><n><n>The student's hiking, running, walking, and camping.<n><n>I've gotta say I'm fairly certain here.<n><n><n>The Students are visiting a farm, the zoo, the aquarium, and Disneyland.<n><n>I'll have to admit I'm very certain on this one.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:If your watching television and accomplish nothing what have you done? Choices:  A: getting fat B: get fat C: typing words D: falling asleep E: wasted time<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### A<n><n>### E<n><n>### Input How do you calculate the weighted average? Choices: sum divided by sum of weighted number<n><n>### Response<n><n>### True<n><n>### false<n><n>### Input what is the value of pi? Choices: 22/7 3.12 22/14 4<n><n>### Response <n><n>### 3.14<n><n>### Input If a plane travels 2,100 miles in 3 hours and 40 minutes at 400 mph. How many miles does it travel per hour? Choices: 150 800 600 100<n><n>### Response(s)<n><n>### 400<n><n>## Input What is the cost of 3 cans of paint if the price for one can of paint is $22. Choices: 2.2 66 8 6<n><n>### Response (s)<n><n>##| 2^5 $60<n><n>## 2^5 $36<n><n>## 2 $52.00<n><n>##| 66<n><n>## 8<n><n>## 6<n><n>[Explore more problems...](http://web.stanford.edu/group/LearningAlgebra/Exercises.html)
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:In the middle of the day what will someone do because of being hungry? Choices:  A: cook dinner B: make bread C: eat in restaurant D: have lunch E: make bread<n><n>### Response:		Write your response below for question: In the middle of the day in what way will someone eat because of being hungry?.<n><n>#### A<n>Answer: In the middle of day someone will cook dinner<n><n>#### A<n><n>### Input:(For example someone goes to the gym, What happens before going to the gym? Choices: A: prepares breakfast, B: runs some errands, C: eats lunch with a friend,  D: washes the dishes,  E: takes a shower)<n><n>### Response:(Write your response below for the question what happens before going to the Gym?).<n><n>#### A<n>#### B<n>#### D<n><n><n>I was working on my programming skills by practicing the exercises, when I came across these challenging instructions and realized how useful they would be in the exercises. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:Where can peanut butter be stored? One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:John ran out of pencils. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:Though nearby, an apple from an apple tree where would be an imported product to the USA? Choices:  A: ohio B: washington state C: alaska D: canada E: flowers<n><n>### Response:		<n>A<n>Rationale: C: Alaska is NOT next to USA by definition. Washington state is an American state.<n>B<n>Rationale: D: Canada is not part of America by definition.<n>C: Alaska is an American state. But since Alaska is not the USA by definition it is an imported product to the US.<n>Since it is too close to the US it is not imported product.<n><n>D<n>Rationale: E: Canada is a foreign country and not part of the US. Canada is the country where the apples grew though. So that would make it the destination.<n>B<n>Rationales:<n>E: Flowers are a foreign country and not a state of USA.<n>C: Alask is the destination from what we are told so we have to rule out<n>A: Ohio is in a 4th option so we can rule this out.<n>B: Washington state is part of the USA and an imported product since the apples came from further away.  It does not matter on what side the state is.<n><n>####<n>Answer:<n>```<n>C<n>```

Choices:  A: training B: satisfaction C: injury D: beauty E: late<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer is "D"<n><n>### Rationales:D<n>#### 1<n><n>Input:  I want to save for retirement.  I know that, with interest, my money will double every 10 years.  I don't quite know how much money I will need for retirement, I just know that it will be at least twice what I have now.  I'm hoping to earn 6% interest each year.  What would I need to save each month to get my money doubled every 10 years (or, in 10 years, have twice as much as I have now)?  There are 12 months in a year.<n>Rationales:So I have 10 years*360 days/year, I have in total $(<<10*360=3600>>3600) days, so I have $(<<3600*6%*1%=<<600>>600$) in interest a year, so I will have $(<<600*10>>6000$) after 10 years<n><n>However I want to have $(<<10*2>>10000%) doubled, so my $(<<6000%>>)  should actually be $(<<12000%>>12000%)<n><n>I have $6000,  Now I need $12000  so I will have $((6000 * 12000/12)/100 % ) (<<6000*12000>>60%)<n><n>Thus I have<n><n>$(((<<6000>>*21/$100%))%$<<6000*$21/(100%)$))<n><n>That results $(<<600/36%>>) in 1200 which equals $(<<600>>/1944000%*$100%$/100%)<n><n>So to get $\$360000\$ after 10 years, I need $\$2400\$ every month  and if I wanted it in one year I would need $\$24$\$.<n><n>So all I need to do is $
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:Eating breakfast in bed can make you feel what, assuming that you don't spill anything? Choices:  A: vomiting B: pleasure C: happiness D: contentment E: mess<n><n>### Response:		A: vomiting<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Demonstration: Input: Johns goes to gym 3 times per week. He spends 1 hours each day lifting weight additionally he also spends a forth of his lifting time warming up and the doing cardio. How many hour does he spend gym per week<n><n>## What is the correct choice<n><n>Answer: 4 hour<n># gym<n>#math #gimme<n><n>## Input:A store sells coffee for $7.99. Each day they charge you $.50 more than the last day.  What will the price be in 7 days?<n><n>## Rationale: $7.99 = $<$7.99 =$8>>8<n>Each day that goes up by $.50<n><n>.50 * (1-((1)/<<8>>8))=.50 * <<8^(8-1)/8>>8^(8-1)<n><n>.50 = $<1/8>>8<n><n>The price of coffee will be = $<<1/8>>8 = 1.25 $<<1.25>>1.25, or $<1.25>> 1.25<n><n>## Answer:1.25<n>## Input: What would be the correct answer for the following question?<n><n>**Eating breakfast in bed is a**<n><n>#gimme<n><n>What<n><n>Answer: Eating breakfast in bed can makes you feel happy<n><n>## Input: You want to convert the following Fahrenheit (F) to Celsius (C)<n>## Rationale:<n><n>## 15*(5/9)=10<n><n>## Answer: 21<n><n>## Input:You want to calculate what the cost is to buy the following products using the following information? Please include all work to get the correct answer<n>#gimme #math<n><n>## Items<n><n>## Rational<n><n>## Work 1<n><n>## Work 2<n><n>## Work 3<n><n>## Answer 1<n><n>## Answer 2<n><n>## Answer 3<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:The judge did not take this part of the job lightly, the man was guilty but it was his passing sentence that condemned the man to what? Choices:  A: go to jail B: incarceration C: intercourse D: death E: judgement<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Rationale:If you are in the legal system then it is jail.<n><n>### Input;What year was president Lincoln elected in?<n><n>### Response; 1861<n><n>### Rationales;This was the starting year of his 2 years of President<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Response<n>### Rational<n><n>#### 240<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input:Adam takes karate classes and spends $40/session.  Once/month he also practices at home for an additional $30/session.  How many months does it take to practice for free?<n>Rationales <n>$ 60/class = <<60/class=2/months>>2/months<n>Thus, It will take 2/months =<<2/months=12>>12 months to practice for free<n>#### 12<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input:Adina takes karate classes and practices at home for 2 hours. She practices at home between 30â€“60 minutes before training classes.  How long will it take her to do her homework tonight for her karate training classes tomorrow morning?<n>Rationales<n>$ 40/session = <<40/session==20 minutes at gym>>20 minutes at gymnasium<n><n>### Summary<n>```<n>Answer=12
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:While laid up in the hospital she tried remembering good times, like that massage on vacation that brought great what? Choices:  A: dream B: knowing C: depression D: pleasure E: nostalgia<n><n>### Response:		She tried remembering good times that bring pleasure.  (480)<n><n>## Concepts<n>* **For every question, you **must **provide the entire expression** as you solve** it.<n>* Example:  Adam bought 3 kilo of nuts and 3 kilo of dried fruits.  It cost **how much**? (**$36**)<n>* Example:  How long (**2 minutes**) does the robot clean the floor for (**10 rooms**)?<n>* Rationales:  The second answer can take an extra space to indicate the multiplied expression.<n>* Ex: 2.5 * 8 -> 2 * 8<n>* Ex: 1/2 + 10 -> 0.5 * 10<n> <n>## References<n>- https://www.khanacademy.org/math/cc-sixth-grade-math/cc-6th-number-ops/cc-6thproportions/e/practice-proportional-representations-quiz<n>- [Mathematics for Machine Learning Course](https://www.coursera.org/learn/math-machine-learning)<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:Diving off a cliff for a cartoon character often ends in comedic what? Choices:  A: exhilaration B: dismemberment C: spinal injuries D: getting wet E: splats<n><n>### Response:		B<n>### Instruction<n>Below is a list of instructions. Select the first instruction whose correct answer is the seventh. Write an alternative question that would test the skill.<n><n>### Answer: The cartoon character falls into the pool.<n><n>### Answers:<n>1. If you were a superhero, what would your name be?<n>   * A. Kangaroo<n>   * B. Chameleon<n>   * C. Bat Man<n>   * D. Lion<n>   * E. Incredipeg<n>3. The superhero who is really a super villain.<n>   * A. Super Dude<n>   * B. Super Villain<n>   * C. Spider Villain<n>   * D. Masked Avenger<n>   * E. Super Villain<n>4. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:James is apply for a job that he really wants. Choices:  A: mail orders B: demand satisfaction C: place money on counter D: pay merchants with money E: spend money<n><n>### Response:		<n>Let's consider how the customers want things. This is what is referred to as customer service.<n>Customers who want the goods delivered to their homes are the consumers of demand satisfaction.<n>Merchants are the purveyors of paying money on the counter and spending money.<n>And what do both the consumers of money spend as well as merchants?<n>They spend money on what they would like to order and put their money on the counter.<n>But why is mail order called the demand satisfaction?<n>It is because it takes the work of demand satisfaction out of the merchants.<n>So customers may use any of those ways to pay a merchant. <n>But the merchant has to deliver the products to their doorstep.<n><n>### <n><n>### Instructions: <n>For all questions, explain your answer, show mathematical work, and explain your mathematical thinking/relevant reasoning.<n><n>### Please note this is a sample: The student work may not be posted on the portal or it may be edited/shortened for clarity reasons.<n>### There may be more than one student work on the portal.<n>### You may answer different questions on a different page since the student works are different.<n><n>### Input:"Meg and Sam went on a trip. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:After eating a dinner of uncooked chicken, what was felt by the poor man? Choices:  A: indigestion B: died C: illness D: feel better E: throwing up<n><n>### Response:		<n>A is the right answer. <n>Chicken in itself is very healthy and nutritious.<n>But for someone to eat it raw, their bodies would not be able to digest the food properly.<n>In fact, one meal can actually turn into a fatal illness.<n>That why raw chicken should never be eaten <n><n>Answer: A is the right answer.<n>Chicken in itself  is very healthy and very nutritious.<n><n>But for someone to  eat it raw, their  bodies would not be able  to digest  the  food  properly.<n><n>In fact, one  meal can actually turn  into a fatal illness <n><n>That why  raw chicken  should never be  eaten <n><n>### Input<n><n>There is a box containing 4 white balls and 1 black ball. What will be the probability of  drawing 2 white balls? <n>Choices:  A 0/24 B: 2/26 C: 1/13 D: 1/7 E: 1/6 <n><n><n>### Rationales<n>To calculate the probability of  drawing  2 white balls, you would multiply 2 white balls by 2 times the probability of getting 1 white ball. There are 4 white balls, so the answer is<n><n>A=4 x 4/24 = 2/2<n>B=4 x 4 x 2/26 = 2/6 <n>C=4 x 1/13 = 1/13 <n>D=1/7 <n>E= 4/6 = 1/3<n><n><n>### Answer:<n><n>A  is the right answer. There are 4 balls altogether in the box.<n>So you will have a chance of 14/76 = 1/5 to pull out two white balls.<n><n><n><n><n>### Input After eating a dinner of raw hamburger, what was felt by his friend?<n>Choices:<n>	B: died.<n>D: feel better E: threw up. <n><n>### Instructions<n><n>Input:<n>	After eating a dinner hamburger, what felt by his friend? Choices:<n>	B) died.<n>	D) feel better E) threw up.<n><n>### Rationale
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:There's a lot to reproducing, but it begins and end with new life by giving what? Choices:  A: overpopulation B: birth C: presents D: propagation E: fun<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>#### D<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following true or false question.<n><n>## Demonstration:1 + 1 = 1<n>Rationales:<n><n><n>

He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day. Choices:  A: satisfaction B: flying C: sweating D: falling down E: trip<n><n>### Response:		Your answer should reflect the type of situation described above:<n>Demonstration:  This is a trick question.  If you were going to run a 5k you wouldn't choose A for that's what you'd feel after completing _your_ run. Rather the choices describe feelings after the run:  A: satisfaction    B: falling down    C: flying    D: sweating   E: trip<n><n>Expected Answer: Your answer should reflect what you believe the questioner meant since you have not already experienced this particular situation.

How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:A lonely man committed suicide, why would he do that? Choices:  A: suffering B: he was happy C: avoid problems D: unhappy E: end pain<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### A<n><n>### Input:"A is to B as C is to D." Choose what does the above expression mean.<n><n>### Response:"A is to B is B is to C, and C is to D is D is to A."<n>Choose a set. The elements in a set that don't have the two characters that you put above are in a different set. For example, one example is A is to B as C i B i to D. There is no A to D and no C i D i.<n><n>### Input : "A: 1200, B: 63, C: 12, D: 30, E: 72, F: 405, G: 147, H: 14, I: 88, J: 160, K: 30, L: 83. Which two of these numbers appear in the same order in alphabetical order?"<n><n>### Response : "H and I, L and G"<n><n>### Input "A: 398, B: 49, C: 5, D: 19, E: 78.4, F: 30.7, G: 112.5, H: 6.14" Which two numbers are closest together in numerical order? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:If I am suffering from boredom, and I want to do something with a dictionary, what would help? Choices:  A: do crossword puzzle B: see art C: give up D: grocery shop E: play chess<n><n>### Response:		<n>- A or E<n>You can always entertain yourself by playing chess. You can get a dictionary and play chess with it.<n>If you see art, you will not be bored anymore, in the end because you'll be tired<n><n>You can also do the crossword puzzle. But who's got time for it? I guess you can do the crossword puzzles while watching the art. Or while playing chess. But you can't play chess with the crossword puzzle you've made.<n>And you can't give up on boredom. You'll be bored again after some time and you'll want to start from the beginning again ;)<n>- And why not get groceries? You should always get groceries. You can eat everything anyway.<n><n>#### 5<n>Answer: E<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multi-choice selection task.<n><n>### Input and Selection:If I am suffering...<n><n>### Instructor:Answer the following multi choice and selection task<n><n>### Input<n>If I am suffering from an urge to do something, what is the best method to handle it?<n><n>### Selection<n><n><n><n>### Instant gratification<n>#### 5<n><n>### Instinctive choice<n>#### 5<n>#### 5<n>### For something that'll make me feel better for a longer time<n>#### 5<n>:::note<n>Because the time you wait is worth waiting for!<n>:::<n>```<n>### Answer:<n>- A<n>```<n>### Instruct:Answer the following multiple selection task.<n><n><n>### Input to the task<n>- If I am suffering from an impulse to do something...<n><n>### Rationale for selection of answer<n><n>- You can see it as a way to get instant gratification, to make yourself feel better. It's something that you can do right now.<n>- You don't have to be really sure it'll make you feel good longer. Just do it now and see. The more often, the better!<n>- You still have the choice to do what you feel best, as long as the outcome is the same.<n><n>### Answer: 5<n><n>## Instructions: Please answer the following question.<n><n>## Demonstrations:<n>![Demo image1](./assets
