Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:Simon bought a cow because he wanted to put it to work.   He didn't want any meat for it.  Where might Simon be taking the cow? Choices:  A: countryside B: city C: dairy farm D: butcher shop E: canada<n><n>### Response:		Simon is taking the cow to a dairy farm.<n><n>### Input :<n>A: countryside<n>Input: Simon bought a cow because he didn't want any of it's meat.  Simon would like to take the cow out into the countryside.  Would Simon be taking the cow home? Choices:  Yes  No<n><n>Rationales: Simon would not be taking the cow home.<n><n>### Response<n>No<n><n>#### 2<n>Answer: No<n><n>### Input<n>N: no<n>Input: Adam goes to the grocery store. Adam bought toothpaste, detergent, and pizza. Adam spent 10% of his total income on detergent and 17% of his income on the pizza. What percentage did he spend on toothpaste?<n><n>### Response :<n>The percentage that Adam spent on toothpaste is 63%.<n><n>#### 63%<n>Answer: 63<n><n>### Input 2<n>The total income that Adam spent on all of his purchases = 64% of his total income.<n><n>The amount of toothpaste that Adam purchased = (10% * 64%) = 6<n><n>The total income that Simon spent on the purchases that the customer made = (17% * 61%) = (10.59 * 61%).<n><n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n>

He also buys 2 sodas for $1.50. How much did he spend?<n>Rationales<n><n>The total he spent was 20+$<<2*1.50=3>>3<n><n>#### B.<n>Input: A 20-minute hot dog at a ball game costs $3.50. How many hot dogs must be eaten for the price to be the same as the cost of the hot dog and one soda?<n>Rationales <n><n>You need 27 hot dogs with the price after buying a hot dog and one sode.<n><n>#### C.<n>Input:<n>The price for a 140-mile taxi ride is $100.  The hourly cost is $0.70/mile.  Suppose you want to cut down on cabbing and decide to fly your entire trip.  What is the total cost for the round trip? And will you save more than $100 by flying? If so, by how much?<n><n>Rationales<n>So if the airplane costs $0.70 per mile that means you need to fly 140 miles(140*0.70=<<140*0,70=100>>100 miles)<n>And since we travel in both directions, the total price you pay for the round trip will be (2*100)=<<2*100=200>>200<n>So in total you will save $100 by airplane and $100/1.70$<<100/1,70=58,57%>>58.57%<n><n>### Input<n><n>If you buy 4 bottles of water at $4 each and 10 cans of soda at 50 cents each, should you save money?<n>Rationales We need to solve 4*4+10*50<25+80<n>But we will save money because 80<25+4*4(16)<80+25+160<n>So we will save money<n><n>####

He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%. Choices:  A: accompaniment to meal B: waitress C: cafeteria D: home E: menu<n><n>### Response:		<n>> Dear Restaurant, I want a glass of milk. Please add to your menu 'glass milk $<<<< "Glass milk $" => "Glass milk $">>>'><n><n>### Input 1:I would like some fruit. Choices:  A. orange B. apple C. grapes D. banana E. pear<n><n>### Result<n>>Dear Restaurant, Please add to your menu "apple $<<<< "apple $" => "apple $">>>'><n>#### Apple<n>#### Orange<n>#### Pear<n>#### Banana<n>#### Grapes<n>#### Menu<n>##### 5<n><n>### Input A:I would like the apples for $2.00 per pound Choices: A) 1 lb. B)) 11 lb. C) 3 lb. D) 3.25 lb. E) $120<n><n>### Result:Apple<n>```<1><n>$><n>Apple<n>---<n>1 lb $<<<<"Apple 50cents per pound 1>".join()+"$">>>'<n>```<n>#Restaurant Management<n><n>### How to use<n>> Run <n>>> python Restaurant_Manager.py<n>>> python <path>/Restaurant_Manager.ipynb<n>

If it takes the car 160 minutes to travel from New to York, what is its average speed?<n><n>Rationales: We know speed=distance/time<n>So 160/10 = <<160/160>>160 mph<n>The answer is <<160 mph>>160mph<n><n>#### 160<n>Answer: 160<n><n>Input: Which of the following uses the square root symbol?  A: 15 2 B: 47 C: 475 D: 350 E: 50  <n><n>#### Choice D<n><n>Input: What is the sum of 14 and the number 67?<n>Rationales<n>14 + 67 = <<14+67=70>>70<n><n>####70<n>Answer: 70<n><n>###Instruction:  Add and reduce the numbers to get a new and simplified answer.  Remember that + means add and -= means subtract.  For example 5 + 2 = 7<n>#### 499.5<n>Answer: 495<n><n>[1]: http://www.mikesys.com/solve-multi-step-equations.html

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:i like to examine different things,why do books the chapters on the back Choices:  A: examine thing B: go somewhere C: knit D: read book E: see particular program<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>If you like to examine different things and there are chapters on the back of the book i would read this book.<n><n>### Input : i did not realize what to do and how to solve this problem, i am worried.<n><n>Choices :<n><n>A. : i am sorry<n>B. : i am not sorry<n>C. : please stop it<n><n>\<n><n>### Demolistion:<n>Answeer: B<n><n><n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:What is a great, but non-specific, overall benefit of exercise? Choices:  A: good health B: heart attacks C: relaxation D: rest E: fatigue<n><n>### Response:		<n>Which answer to choose?<n><n>### Rationale:<n>Which answer is an excellent description?<n><n>### Input What can happen to a body from too much exercise?<n><n>### Response<n><n>Which answer best defines "overuse" injuries?<n><n>### Demostration <n>The human body undergoes normal wear and tear, even from everyday activities or injuries caused from accidents. These wounds are known as "overuse" injures; they are called overuse injures because they happen from over use and can be prevented by rest or avoidance of that movement, exercise or action that injures a muscle, tendon or ligament.<n><n>### Input A: Caffeine is commonly known to increase athletic performance. Choices:  A: stress B: debate C: argument D: winning or losing E: tension<n><n>### Response:		<n>Option A: Stress<n><n>Input: One of the largest problems facing many adults is stress.  It costs 8 million workdays lost every year for employees in England.  Nearly 50% of those missed days are due to long-term stress.  Stress is having a long-lasting impact on the UK.  What does the UK government say about work related stress?<n>Rationales:"Work related stress is one of the largest problems facing employees every year in the UK. It can have an impact on both physical and mental health.<n><n>#### 50%<n>Answer: 50%<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Use the rationales to complete the multiple choice question for each of the 10 statements. Please answer in complete sentences.<n><n>What is one way that an employee might reduce work related stress? Choices:  a: Have a daily routine b: Set goals c: Take a lunch break d: Drink coffee/tea e: Do yoga<n><n>Input: A good way to reduce stress while at work is to complete a daily exercise. When asked by employers what a worker might do to reduce on-the-job stress, they often respond by saying that exercise is a positive way to relax. <n>Rationales: One way that an employee might reduced work related stress <n><n>#### c<n>Answer: c<n><n>### Instucture:Input: The following chart shows two different views of the same table. How could the line graph and bar graph compare?  Choices: a: Bar graph is more accurate b: Line graph shows bigger change c: Line graph shows more change d: Line graph shows less change e: Bar graph shows more change<n>Input: The following chart show two different views of the samethe table.  A Line graph and Bar graph can differ in multiple ways.  How <n><n>### Response:"Answers d: Line graph shows smaller change " <n><n>Rationales:Answers d:Line graph shows smaller change <n><n>### Instructor: What is one way that the information on lines 1-10 and lines 11-20 compare? Choice: a: Lines 1-10 show a bigger decrease b: Lines 11-25 show a smaller increase c: Lines 18-25 show a bigger increase d: Lines 1
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:Where is a paper notice likely to be left on a house? Choices:  A: front door B: conference C: classroom D: refrigerator E: suitcase<n><n>### Response:		 The right answer is refrigerator.<n>A: front door<n>B: conference<n>C: classroom<n>D: refrigerator<n>E: suitcase<n><n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:The obsessive man was always washing hands, he had even done it so much once that it caused a what? One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:Where is known to always have snow? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:Where would you put a light? Choices:  A: ocean B: desk C: universe D: attic E: chair<n><n>### Response:		C - universe<n><n>### rationale:E<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Write two complete sentences that answer the question below. Each sentence should be at least five words. <n><n>### Instructon: How many apples do I need?<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Sentence: I need >>I need<n><n>### 4 senteces:<n>I need 1 apple<n><n>I need 6 apples<n><n>I need 34 apples<n><n>I have the rest of the math

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:If you are fiddling through a music book when you should be playing, you probably dont have? Choices:  A: practice B: dexterity C: idle time D: knowledge of music E: conductor<n><n>### Response:		?<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: The average person has 32 teeth.  What is the average number of teeth?<n><n>#### 32/3=32/3=10.666666<n><n>#### 10.66<n>Answer: 10.67<n><n>### Input:(32/10+1)/2<n><n>### Demstration:<n>### Instruction:(32+1)/2<n>### Instruction::<n><n>### Demos<n><n>### Instructions:Input:<n><n>### Input::<n>4* 2 + 2<n><n>### Answer<n>5<n><n>### Instutions<n>Input:<n><n>## Demostration:6*3 + <n>## Rationale:<n>## Demonstration:28/3 + 5<n><n>## Demonstratio:<n><n>## Instructions:35+(5*2)<n>## Demonstation:<n>35+(5*5)<n><n>## Rationale:Divide 5 by 3.<n><n>Input:A plane flies from San Francisco to Miami, a distance of 2861 miles. It travels at 500 miles an hour. How long does it take to fly the route?<n>## Rationale:Simply divide the distance by the rate, 2861/500 = 5.72.<n><n>## Instuctions::<n><n>## Input:::<n>(60/6)*30+60/3.93<n>## Answer ::?<n><n>## Demonstation::<n><n>18032+276.5 + 9<n><n>## Rationale::<n>#2. The whole number part(60) * 2 is 120<n><n>#4. Since we did 120/6 for the first part, we do the same for the second 120/3<n><n>#6. Since we're not using a math symbol for the last number in the question, we multiply times 3, making it 18<n><n>Rationale:<n><n>## Instruction:<n><n>## Rationale<n>54/2*2+2<n><n>## Input:<n><n>## Rational:<n><n>## Input:650
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:Mary wasn't familiar with James, so she wasn't comfortable speaking with him. How might she come off? Choices:  A: cold B: unfamiliar C: unknown D: unacquainted E: shy<n><n>### Response:		<n>Input: Mary wasn't familiar with  James, so  she wasn't comfortable  speaking with him. How  might she come off?<n>Rationales : A: cold- Mary was cold but she wasn't cold with James<n>B: unfamiliar- James was unfamiliar with Mary but Mary was unfamiliar with James<n>C: unknown- James is unknown Mary because he didn't know her but she was unknown with James<n>D: unacquaint- James wasn't aware of Mary but Mary wasn't aware of James<n>E: shy- She wasn't comfortable because she is shy.<n><n>#### E: shy<n>Answer: shy<n>

He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:What might someone want to be if he or she is thick? Choices:  A: slender B: free flowing C: sparse D: unacquainted E: diet<n><n>### Response:		Choose from A: slender<n><n>#### Slender<n>Answer: slender<n><n>### Input : If two people work for the same company, and you ask them how long they've worked for the company, then one of them will say he's  been working there 20 years, and the other will say he's been there for 30 years.What's the maximum possible number of years in which the two people began working at the same time?<n><n>### Response : Choose from 30 years.<n><n>#### 30 years<n>Answer: 30 years<n><n>### Input  : What's an example of an English equivalent for the German word "Gedanken"?<n><n>### Response  : Choose from Ruminating.<n><n>#### Ruminating<n>Answer: Ruminating<n><n>### Input1 : In Japan there are 2010 people per square kilometer. In America, there are approximately 30 people per kilometer. How many times more people are there per square kilometer in America than are there per kilometers in Japan?<n><n>### Demostration : 2010/30 =<<2010/12010/0.66 =15>>15<n><n>### Response1 : Choose from 15<n><n>#### 15<n>Answer: 15<n><n>## Input2 : You have a group of 400 children in a classroom, and you have 100 children in two classrooms. Half of the classrooms have 24 children, and the other classrooms have 18 children. How many more children are in classrooms with more students than classrooms with fewer students?<n><n>## Demostration : <table border="1" cellpadding="5" style=" width:30%;  height: 110px;" ><n> <tr> <th> ClassRooms</th><n>  <th> Number of Students </th>  <n> </tr><n>  <tr bgcolor = "blue"> <td>Classroom A</td> <td>24</td>   </tr ><n>  <tr bgcollar = "blue"> <th>Classroom B</th> <td>18</td></tr ><n></table><n><n>## Response2 :
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:What is made out of only one piece? Choices:  A: jigsaw puzzle B: chess game C: puzzle box D: jigsaw puzzel puxxle E: puxxle<n><n>### Response:		What's made out of a single piece?<n>#### C<n>Answer: Puzzle Box<n><n>

How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane. How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:The master control for the Tardis is where in the main room? Choices:  A: nuclear power plant B: center C: basement D: main office E: bowel of the ship<n><n>### Response:		<n>I was looking at [this question](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/10567160/why-would-you-store-the-entire-contents-of-a-2d-array-in-an-int), and I thought of this problem. The problem is like most of my problems in my life: there's an int array.<n><n>So, let's write some code for this problem. I have a `Main.java` file that has the public class `Main`.<n><n>```java<n>class Main {<n>  public static void main (String[] args) {<n>      int bowelOfTheShip = mainRoom();<n>      System.out.println("The master control for the tardis is where in the room? It's: " + bowelOfTheShhip);<n>  }<n>}<n>```<n><n>I defined three public static methods to create a helper. We have some helpers as follows: `A = nuclear power plant`, `B = center`, `C = basement`, and `D = main office`.<n><n>```java <n>boolean bowelOfTheShipr(String[] arg){<n>  boolean correct = false;<n>  if(arg[0] == "center"){<n>   correct=true;<n>  }else if(arg[0]=="basement"){<n>   correct = true;<n>  }else{<n>   correct = false;<n>   System.out.println(arg[0] + " is not a valid choice");<n>  }<n><n>  if(correct)<n>  {<n>   System.out("The bowel of the tardis is the " + arg[0]);<n>  }else{System.exit(20);<n>  }<n>  <n>}   <n><n>  boolean nuclearPowerPlant(String[] arg){  <n>  boolean correct = true;<n>  <n>  if(arg){<n>    if(arg[0]+" is a nuclear power plant or center"){<n>      return correct;<n>    }else{<n>    System.out.println ("please verify if you want a choice that ends with a letter.");<n>    }<n>  }else{  <n>    System.out("please enter a choice");<n>  } <n>  return correct;<n> }<n> boolean mainOffice(String[] arg){   <n> boolean correct = false
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:There was a show on television about a ranger who loved flowers, but the next day it was about a gardener who also loved flowers.  It was a what? Choices:  A: countryside B: anthology C: dull read D: state park E: surface of earth<n><n>### Response:		<n>* Bouncing on the floor he said, "Those bloody rangers!"  He kicked the coffee table and it smashed to pieces.  "What am I going to do now?"  He asked me.  He's looking out the window, but his face is still smashed and bloody.  "I guess I'll have to clean it," I say.  "Do you know how to clean all this blood up?"  "No," he says.  "Do you?"

Choices:  A: roof B: room C: floor D: apartment E: neighbor's house<n><n>### Response:		 A<n><n>#### $answer_1:A<n><n>### Input:(The next 3 questions will be a long set of numbers and letters)<n><n>### How many hours will be in one week?(This is 52 weeks/year)<n>Rationales:  So for 52 weeks, 52/7 would bring us<n><n>```<n>-  52/7=<<52/7=-->7<n>-840<n>```<n><n>So there are 7 days in a week<n><n>So 7*52 = <<7*52=3640>>3640<n>Therefore, seven times thirty-six hundred forty is equal to five twenty-four.<n><n>#### 840<n>Answer: 840<n><n>### How old are you?<n>Rationales So let's take age into account. This is the only question I have here, so you should get it.<n><n>#### 18<n>Answer: 18<n><n><n>### What is $5*4+1$<n>Rationales:<n><n><n><n><n><n>*I'm stuck and this is the best I can do<n><n><n><n><n>#### $answer1:A<n><n><n>### 123 question<n>This is just for some sort of fun. I found that if I say the number 4 out loud, 10 times, it's almost exactly $8*7$. I don't know why, but the pattern of it going from 9 to 12 three times is pretty cool, especially how it always happens in 3. So, here's this really crappy number: $3 * 3 * 3*$<<10*3=30>>30.<n><n>#### $answer2:D<n><n>### What would you put furniture onto? Choose either A,B,C,D, or E.<n><n><n><n><n>### Which one of these is NOT a method of storing data?<n>- Choice A<n>- Choice B<n>- Choice C<n>- Choice D<n>- Choice E<n><n>Rationales: B is data, A is a method of input, C is a method of storage, D & E are not methods.<n><n><n>#### $E$<n>Answer: $answer 2:E$<n><n><n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:You can read a magazine where while waiting for your transportation on rails to arrive? Choices:  A: train station B: bookstore C: newsstand D: waiting room E: airport<n><n>### Response:		A<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:Where can you eat fruit on a red bridge? Choices:  A: refrigerator B: engineering school C: san francisco D: tree E: market<n><n>### Response:		<n>The first choice is the refrigerator because fruit are kept inside it to last longer.<n><n>The second choice is the engineering school because we can get the fruit from there.<n><n>The third choice is the san francisco because at this place we can purchase fruits and other things.<n><n>The fourth choice is the market because we can get fruits from there.<n><n>### Input<n>Whatâ€™s another option to say that itâ€™s not raining in Boston?<n><n>### Response<n>It's not raining in boston means there's a possibility of rain.<n><n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:What makes people happy when it is surprising and unexpected? Choices:  A: joke B: humor C: frightened D: fight E: laughter<n><n>### Response:		Answer A because people get happier when they are surprised and expectations are fulfilled.<n><n>### Rationales: Answer A: Because most unexpected things are the most surprising and funny than others.<n>

What is the total monetary value of the computers?<n><n>### Answer 1:220<n><n>### Response 1:A<n><n>## Input:Janeâ€™s aunt purchased three $60 ties, three $40 ties, and three $80 ties. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:An attempt to confirm an applicant's reference would fail if the reference does what? Choices:  A: question B: dispute C: deny D: contradict E: refuse<n><n>### Response:		A: question<n><n>1. A: question<n><n>#### 1<n>Answer: question<n><n>1.__A:The reference would fail if the person who is being checked refuses to answer a question asked by the employer or potential employer.<n><n>Answer: The reference would fail if the applicant refuses to answer a  question asked by the employ<n>Answer : Question<n><n><n>### Input<n><n>#### Input:A bank account is in an overdraft because? Choices: 1: there is not enough money in the account to cover the transaction. 2: the transaction has not been completed yet. B: 3: There is more in the account than is needed for the transaction, but there is not much extra. C:the bank will not be able to cover the transaction. D2: The transaction has been completed but not cleared.<n>#### 1<n>1.:There is not enough money in account to cover the transaction,<n>#### 2<n>2.:The transaction has been completed but has not been cleared,<n>#### 3<n>3.:There is not enough in the account to cover transaction.<n>#### 4<n>4.:The transaction has not been completed  yet<n>#### 5<n>5..There is more in the account  than   is needed  for  the  transaction,   but  there    is not much extra<n><n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:Where is a microphone boom likely to be covering a stock market event? Choices:  A: new york B: concert C: tv studio D: gig E: recording studio<n><n>### Response:		<n>A is the answer: New York<n><n>### Instructions:Write the letter of the choice that best answers the rationale.<n><n>- What are the names of the two parties that make up the two-party system under the  original constitution?<n><n>- What are your favorite holiday celebrations?<n><n>- What does the term aforesaid mean?<n><n>#### E<n><n>- What are some of the challenges that teachers experience in the first several years of teaching? <n><n>#### F<n><n>- According to the U.S. Department of Labor, how many hours per week do U.S. physicians work as a result of medical appointments?<n><n>#### E <n><n>- What are you looking forward to the most in the upcoming school year? <n><n>#### D<n><n>- What are four common items purchased by the federal government? <n><n>#### B<n><n>- As part of the 1794 Treaty of Paris, which area of the United States was returned to France? <n><n><n>### Instution:Answer the following two choice question.<n><n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: James can play 3 different musical instruments.  Last week, he had 20 lessons.  How many lessons did he have on each instrument?<n>Rationales<n>- He played banjo for 10 lessons<n>- He played guitar for 30 lessons<n>- and he played drums for 10 lesson<n><n>=> For Banjo we have: 10*3=<<10*3=30>>30 lessons<n>For Guitar we have: 30*3=<<30*3=90>>90 lessons<n>(We don't need to repeat for Drums since we only played 10 lessons) <n>=> We have 90+30=<<90+30>>120 lessons <n><n>#### 120<n>Answer: 120<n><n>Input: A trucking company charges $2 for the first 100 miles and $0.20 for each additional mile thereafter.  Truckers can also earn commissions on the loads they carry.  How  much money does a trucker earn? <n>Rationales: $20*2=<<20*

One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:What happens to cats every day? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:John lives in Texas. If he takes the highway South and doesn't stop, where will he end up next? Choices:  A: oklahoma B: developed land C: united states D: desert E: mexico<n><n>### Response:		The answers are in order from the lowest to the highest. So the answer would be: A, B, E, C, D. And since there's an unknown value in the set, we select option A. <n><n><n>### Input->A woman named Sally goes to the movie about two times a week.  On Tuesdays, she goes to watch a play for $20.  On Wednesdays, she goes to the movie for $25.  How much does total does Sally spend on entertainment for these two days?<n><n>### Response->250<n><n>### Rationales->On tuesday, Sally's total price is $20*2=$<<$20*2=40>>$40, on Wednesday the total her total price is $25 $25*1=$<<$25*0=0>>0, we add the total prices to get the final answer $20*2+$25=$<<$20*$6=240>>$240<n><n>###  Input->A man named John goes to the park three times a week for $5. When Wednesday's the day, he spends $3 more.  How much does he spend during the week?<n>### Response->16<n>###  Rationales->To do simple math, $5*3=$<<$5*3=15>>$15, and $20-$15=$<<$2=5>>$5, so therefor his weekly expense is $5+$5=$<<5+5=10>>$10. And since each day is different, we need to take the value of day to sum the weekly expense, here $10+$10+$11=$<<10+10+11=31>>$31, which is the answer<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:What happens when you take a shower after going for a run? Choices:  A: feeling refreshed B: becoming tired C: restlessness D: leg cramps E: sweating<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Rationale: Explanation: I exercise quite often and when your body is saturated in sweat it can become very uncomfortable as well as sticky with hair becoming damp.  With how my hair tends to be after a run, it's a must to have a shower in order to become clean and refreshed.<n><n>### Input<n>I made a typo on the instructions. How should I make the adjustment?<n><n>### Input <n>Answer: 4E<n><n>### Demostration<n>Input: What happens when you take a nap after having a bad day? Choices:  a) restlessness b) feeling refreshed. c) sweating d) leg cramps e) becoming tired<n>Rationales: Felt so bad today<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:No matter the background of the person, they should all be given what in applying for the job? Choices:  A: critical thinking B: congratulated C: equal opportunity D: compliments E: raffle tickets<n><n>### Response:		Critical thinking<n><n>### Rationale: Even if a person doesn't meet the qualifications for the job, such as having a college degree, they should get a chance to prove themselves. The hiring company benefits from getting to learn about their employees' potential more than someone just because their resume looked better.<n><n>### Input:-4>5<n><n>### Demographics:Demographics is the characteristics of people divided into certain groups. <n>### Output:The output is a number between -4 and 5.<n><n>### Rationales:Divide each of the negative numbers and divide them by five.<n><n>### -4>-(4/5)<n><n>### The rational number between -4 and -5 is:  (4/5)*5 = -1<n><n>### -5>-1<n><n>### The negative rational number between -5 and -1 is:  -1<n><n>## What is a rational number?<n><n>- it can be written as a fraction where both the top and bottom are whole numbers<n><n>- the value cannot be simplified any further<n><n>- any irrational number is not rational<n><n>## What is meant by the value of x in a rational expression?<n><n>The value of x is the variable that is being simplified. This can be seen by the number above the x in the fraction if it is underlined in any way, which means that it is the x.<n><n>## What is x if 2 is divided by both the numerator and denominator?<n><n>There's no division by x since x is not a value on either the numerator or denominator. Just because there is division by 2 does not mean that there is division by x.<n><n>## Where do rational numbers appear in this equation? 3x-1=13<n><n>In this equation there are no rational numbers. You see 3x-1 in the numerator and x in the denominator. But there is no rational number above a x since both the denominator and numerator both are not rationals.<n><n>## The value of x in an equation is ___.<n><n>the variable in an equation <n><n>## What is the value of x if 3/4 of a dollar gets you 9/8 of a dollar?<n><n>x = (9/8)/(3/4)<n><n>## What

How should he spend his money to go to the movie?<n>Rationales:(i)He needs to spend no more tham $20.<n>He can save $20 with an answer no one movie ticket.<n><n>(ii)Each pair of movies tickets costs $20.<n>(iii)Each individual ticket costs $10.<n>(iv)(iii)Since he can save nothing with an answer no movies ticket he need to purchase 1 pair of tickets.<n>(v)1 pair of tickets costs 20.<n><n>Therefore,He has enough money to purchase 1 pair.<n>#### $20<n>Answer: $20<n><n>### Instructions:Write a response that appropriately chooses whether or not to accept a request and why.<n><n>### Response to:I do not accept because I will have no money left over if I accept that request.<n><n>##### Instructions<n>Writing  Prompt<n>Write a response to the email below. Choices:  A: read B: passenger C: land plane D: fly the plane E: buy tickets<n><n>### Response:		<n>When you want to purchase a $500 watch and you have cash, you will either have to buy the watch and pay in full for it or buy it with 50% down payment (or deposit as 50%) and pay the rest of it in two equal monthly payments.<n>If you pay 50% deposit, how much do you have to pay each month to pay the full amount?<n>#### 700<n>If you pay 750 each month, youâ€™ll pay full value in 30 months<n>30 / 2 = <<30/2=15>>15 months<n><n>### Instrument:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Instructions:Answer the following multiple response question. How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:Where is a good place to sore a wind instrument in you home? Choices:  A: under bed B: symphony C: music room D: band practice E: music store<n><n>### Response:		Option E<n><n>### Input<n><n>>You want to find out wich food is more caloric: beer or bread. Which factor affects your answer? A: calories per gram of food B: serving size C: price<n>><n><n>### Response<n><n>>Choice A<n><n>### Input You want to use a 99.5% water-soluble drug. What would be the best choice for a base? A: acetone B: ethyl ether C: dichloromethane D: trifluoroacetate E: HCl<n><n>### Response Choice A<n><n>### Instrucation<n><n>- Find the average monthly cost of the house including insurance and utilities, interest on the loan, and maintenance.<n>- If the loan is paid off, include 1. The difference in the loan paid off and the total amount of the loan, 2. the amount paid to the loan each month, 3. the interest only on the loan, and 4. the interest paid only on the loan since it was paid off.<n><n>### Response A<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:She curled up under a blanket to get warm, this made her what on the couch as they started movie? How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week. Choices:  A: backpack B: bookcase C: office supply store D: office E: class room<n><n>### Response:		Input: Where would you find a banner containing homework assignments in A school? Choices: 1) A: backpack 2) B: book case 3) C: office supply store 4) D: office 5) E: class room<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5  <n><n>### Instructions: <n><n>This is a multiple choice problem. To answer the question input each choice and the corresponding rationales.<n><n>> The following table shows the sales of an office supply store.  They sell $11,200 worth of file cases to lawyers each month, $9,000 worth of tape dispensers to engineers, $6,300 worth of folders to secretaries, $1,475 worth of writing paper to students, and $585 worth of white-out to retirees.  Write a ratio that is equivalent to the sum of the ratios of sales in each category.<n>   Rationales: <n>There are two ways to do this. The first is to do division. <n>To find the total sales for each category, simply do the division of the whole sales by all the respective amounts of sales for each category.<n>For file cases, do ($11,20 Ã· 9,000 = 1.25)<n>For tape dispensers, simply divide ($11,2 Ã· 6,300 = 1)<n>For folders (11,20+6,300)/12,600 = 5.75<n>For white out (11,2 Â± 585)/12,685) = 1.585<n>For student use (11,2 + 1,475)/12,715 = 9.333<n><n>The second way of doing it is taking the sum of the rations for each category and find the equivalent ratio for that sum. This approach will result in the same answer. For this approach, we simply add up all the rations, multiply them by 100, and do division by 100. <n>The sum will equal $11,2 + $11,2 â‰ˆ $22,4<n>The 100 multiplied by the total sum will equal

The rest of the ingredients are fruits. <n><n>One way in to this would be, go buy some _ingredients_. 	<n><n>3) Ingredients -> Buy -> Store<n><n>So it's Buy -> Ingredients -> Store.<n><n>3) Ingriendts -> Store -> Buy<n><n>So it'd be Buy -> Ingredient -> Store.<n><n>6) Buy -> Store<n>7) Ingredience -> Store<n><n>So we can make stores -> ingredients<n><n>So it'll be Buy -> Store -> Ingredients and Buy -> Ingrediennts -> Store <n><n>#### 6<n>Answer:6/2=<<6/2=3>>3<n>You can buy and store the ingriedent<n><n># Problem 11<n># Input: I've just been made boss and i have to write a letter to my employees conveying they now have a new boss.<n># Demonstration 1<n># Input:Hello everyone! <n># This letter is to announce a new boss

Choices:  A: medicine cabinet B: chemist's shop C: kitchen D: drug store E: bedroom<n><n>### Response:		<n>Choices: A, E, B, D, C<n><n>####<n>Answer:<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Response<n><n>### Input & Response<n><n>### Instructions <n><n>### Input and Response<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:Where should you find a school in? Choices:  A: residential neighborhood B: mosque C: every city D: prague E: community<n><n>### Response:		<n><n><n> <n><n>### Demostration: <n><n>Inside residential neighborhood<n> <n>

Choices (1 A,2 B,3 C,4 D, 5 E)<n>Output:C<n><n>### Input<n>Output:C<n>####E<n><n>### Input - output<n>How much is a ticket to the concert?<n>####35<n>How much is a gallon of milk?<n>####2<n><n>### Input-response<n>How many gallons is a tub of paint?<n>####4<n>How much does a tub of paint cost?<n>####100<n>### Input - rationales<n>Input: How much is a tub of paint at Home Depot?<n>Output:How many gallons is 1 tub of paint?<n><n>### Input Response<n>####16<n>How much does a pair of jeans that go for $35 cost?<n>### Input Question<n>Answer:<n><n><n>---<n>#### 35<n>### Input - Rationales<n>---<n>Input: Where can the most expensive watch be bought?<n>Output:Where can the most expensive watch been bought?<n><n>### Request<n>1. Which of the following products does not necessarily cost more than 60 dollars?<n>1. a pair of shoes<n>2. a pair of sunglasses	>	1<n>3. a watch	>	False<n>4. a tablet	>	True<n>5. a handbag >	1<n><n>### Rationales<n>There are 5 questions of this kind. You can't make mistakes more than once for those questions to be correct and to receive the credits for them.<n><n>### How to solve them:<n>Ask each of the 5 questions until you find one from 1 or 3 that you make a mistake on.<n>Then do the second one again until you make a mistake.<n>Then do the third one again until you make mistake.<n>Do this for the rest of the questions until you complete all 5 questions.<n><n>### Examples:<n>You should try these questions in order to get 3 credits.<n><n>### The first question: Choose the closest match: (1 of them may not be correct)<n><n>### The second question: Choose the best answer: (1 of them must<n>be correct)<n><n>##### The third question: Which of the following products<n>does not necessarily cost more than

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:If you are driving too fast on an icy road you are being what? Choices:  A: deadly B: dangerous C: unconcerned D: stressful E: harder when weather bad<n><n>### Response:		D. Stressful<n><n>###  Instructions:Choose a letter in the response.<n><n>### Input<n>D: stressful<n><n>### Rationales:<n>* Itâ€™s more stressful when you are driving on ice roads<n><n>### Answer: (D)<n><n>### Instructions: Write a math statement that completes the request. The question asks how much money did Adam spend in total?<n><n>### Rationale: If the nuts cost 12 dollars per kilogram and the dried fruits cost 8 dollars per kilogram, he spent $12*3 plus $8*2.5 dollars.<n><n>### Request: Please write a math statement that shows how much money did Adam spent in total.<n><n>### Answer<n>12*3 + 8*2.5 = <<12*3+8*2.5=25>>25<n><n>### Instuction: Choose a letter from A - E. <n><n>### Rationale:<n>He bought 3 kg of nuts and 6/2.5 kg of dried fruit, and he paid $36 + 20 $ for all purchases with the final expense on $56 for all purchases altogether.<n><n>### Response<n>Answer: B<n><n>### Instructtion: Enter True or False. Which equation will equal true?<n><n>### Input True<n>A = B + C<n><n>### Input False<n>B >= D + E<n><n>### Request<n>Which equation will equal true? Input A, B, C, D, E into each line on the grid. You may enter answers in any order.<n><n>### Answers True: E. False: A.<n><n>### Why?<n><n>A = B +C because E > B.<n><n>The equation below is false.<n><n>B >= D +E.<n><n>E is between of B and D.<n><n>### Example:<n>10 + 3 <= 15+ 5<n><n>5 is below and 15 is above 10, B cannot be between D & E<n><n>### Instriction: What will the first line of the output response contain?<n><n>### Instution: What will the second line of the output response describe?<n><n>### How much?

He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:What has happened to a person's money after he or she has used the last of it? One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:If I recieve a letter from a friend over seas, why might I read it? Choices:  A: pudding B: get news C: strain D: answer E: though<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>Input:If I recieve. Choices:  a letter from a friend  over seas,  why might I read it. Choices:  A B C D E<n><n>### Response<n>E<n><n>### Input<n><n>Input: If you have more than two hours at a museum why would you like it less than having at most one hour left at a museum? Choices:A: at night C: the opposite D: it's boring E: it's bored<n><n>Answer:  E<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>### Input If we had two sets of 3 friends (A, B, and C) that all went to college together, would one of their classes have 5 students or not?<n><n>### Rules<n>* A friend is classified in one of these types: (A: all men, B: all women, C: all men, D:all women)<n>* In the case that no friend sets has 5 members you are to state that it IS NOT necessary for any class to have 5 members<n><n>### Example:<n>* If we have sets of A: All men (M)<n>B: All women (F)<n>C: All men (M), then this is not a set of 3 friends (F_ 5)<n>* If we have set of A: All men, B: All women (F), C: All men, D: All women, then we have this set of 3 friends, however their classes all have 5 members, so one class DOES have 5 members<n>* If we have A: All men,B: All men,C: All women,D: All women, then every class is guaranteed a set of 5 members<n>* This question could be stated this way: is every class guaranteed 5 members?<n><n>### Instractions:<n>* If we had two sets  of 3 students that all went to college and all went  to the same college would one of their classes of 3 students have 5 members or not? Choices: Yes or No.<n><n><n><n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:Where would you see a performer at a gathering of you friends? Choices:  A: cinema B: opera C: party D: stage E: dance<n><n>### Response:		Write an informative answer.<n><n>### Input 2:<n><n>### Demostration 2:<n><n>How to use the library. <n><n>### Instructions:Use the library to answer the next few  questions.<n><n>### How to answer:<n>### a)Use Python to answer the task.<n>
