You won an Xbox by correctly answering all 6 multiple choice questions!<n><n>### Instructoin:Answer the question by writing a code.<n><n>### Question:What do you get by adding up the cost of items listed in the instructions?<n><n>### Rationales:<n>In the instructions, there were 6 multiple choice questions.  The choices provided were:<n>- <n>50<n><n>- <n>20<n><n>-  E       500  <n>Answers:<n>- <n>Answers: $<<A=200+0>>200+$<<B=50+0>>50+$<<C=300+0>>300+$<<D=50-0>>1+$<<E=300-0><n><n>### Output:<n>**Congrats!** you won a 2017 Tahoe!<n><n>### Summery<n>Dear user: Thanks for playing our trivia game! You scored _____ correct answers and have $_______! Here is your code to redeem for your prize:<n>__133__<n><n>### Instuctions:<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:Some stores trick women to buy products, the sales make it seem like if you buy more you what? Choices:  A: get money B: pay money C: go shopping D: lose money E: save money<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: Women get tricked into buying products that are made of cheap materials, when they go to use them they break easily. This means they have to buy more in order to not go to waste their money or get upset and go somewhere else to buy.<n><n>Answer: C<n><n>## Additional Questions<n><n>### 1. Input:Some brands make a sale, so their customers buy their products.<n>Answer: C
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:What does god want people to do for money? Choices:  A: work in life B: speak to people C: everywhere D: sitting ideal E: care for people<n><n>### Response:		<n>The correct and logical response would be answer C.  Working in life would mean physically going to a job and working everyday.  It is not logical to say that talking to people is the best way for an answer to the question asked in this instruction.  Talking to people often deals with personal feelings rather than what is actually best and most logical for one to do.  The correct rational for this answer is <n><n>```r<n>"Go out and work in life everyday."<n>```<n><n>### Input 10: Answer the following multiple choice question to the best of your knowledge: <n>What was the greatest strength of the Roman Empire and what was a notable weakness?<n><n>### Response<n><n>#### Correct answeer<n><n>```r<n>The Roman Empire's greatest strength was their army which won them many battles when they needed to defend themselves.  This allowed for the Romans to expand their empire in many key territories. <n><n>One notable weakness is that they had very little food after all the wars and invasions from conquering nations that happened throughout history. <n>```<n><n>## Task 2:<n>Below is a task where you need to read the example task <n>and write a function named solve that accepts one argument.<n><n>Input: Adam has a set of nouns.  He needs to create a sentence which includes 3 nouns.  For a word to be included in his sentence, it must be in his set of nouns in either order.  How many solutions are possible when he has 3 nouns he can use?<n><n>Example Input: Adam has a set containing the words: apple, banana, caramel.  He needs to make a sentence that includes caramel, apple, banana.  There are 4 solutions.<n>1. apple, caramel, banana<n>2. apple, banana,caramel<n>3. caramel, apple banana<n>4. caramel apple banana<n>There are 4 possible solutions<n><n>Rational for solution 1:<n>caramel, apple,banana <n><n>Rational for Solution 2:<n>apple, caramel,banana<n><n>Rational for Soltuion 3:<n>caramel apple,banana<n><n> Rational for Solution 4:<n> caramel banana,apple

One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:What is the result of instituting civil action? Choices:  A: bad feelings B: confusion C: going to court D: hurt feelings E: sandwiches<n><n>### Response:		<n>Option D<n><n>### Option A<n>Civil action = bad feeling | Option B<n>Civil action = confusion | Option C<n>Civil action = going to court | Option D<n>Civil action = hurt feelings | Option E<n><n>If this question seems confusing I highly encourage trying the task.<n>

If on Saturday he spends 7 hours watching television, what day of the week does he watch the least amount of TV?<n><n>### Answer<n>Adam watches television for 7 hours on Saturday, he watches less than that because he watches TV on Wednesday and Thursday which are both 9 hours at a time. What's one obvious place people might go to celebrate? Choices:  A: state park B: opera C: disneyland D: carnival E: park<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>The place people might go to to celebrate is B.<n><n>#### Reason 1)<n>Opera is a form of entertainment.  If you're going to celebrate an event, you might go to entertain yourself.<n><n>#### Reasons 2)<n>Opera's and other forms of entertainment and theme parks are places where people go to have fun.  If you'd like to celebrate as a method of having fun, it would seem reasonable to go to an amusement park.<n><n>#### Reactions 3)<n>Parks do not make much sense as a means of celebration, as one might not be in the mood to be surrounded by others. However, it is very possible that one could go to a park to celebrate.<n><n>#### Reaction 4)<n>Parks are not forms of entertainment nor are they places to celebrate, as is the case of Disneyland and Carnivals.<n><n>#### Rection 5)<n>Disneyland, which is a place of celebration, is also an amusement park, and a place of entertainment.<n><n>### Input:"Taking over your company would be a great career move for me. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane. Choices:  A: free time B: pleasure C: get divorced D: legal fees E: being lonely<n><n>### Response:		D and e<n><n>We can write this in a sentence as:<n><n>D and e were astronomical, the lawyers' and their clients' time and money.<n><n>I would use (Was), not (Was being) because I would emphasize on the 'time and money' that was being astronomical.  <n><n>(was being) and (were being) are grammatically incorrect when used with 3rd person pronouns.<n><n>So I would use: <n><n>D and e was astronomical, the lawers' and their clients'' time and money!<n>

It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:A school is most likely to be located in what sort of zone? Choices:  A: residential neighborhood B: community C: building D: prague E: every city<n><n>### Response:		A<n>#### A<n>Answer:A<n><n>### Input:-23 + 8.65 = 3 => What is the output?<n><n>### Response:-15.35<n>#### -15.35 + 23.00 = 75/0.12=625 + 230 - 635 = 205 + 23 = 438<n><n>### Input::<n><n>`<input>`<n><n>`. <script type="text/javascript"><n>  alert("Hello world!"); // JavaScript code here<n></script>`<n><n>### Response::<n><n>  `<n><n>  <n><n><n>### Input : Write the following code in Python (Python 3.8.5) without changing the code and using a for loop.<n><n>###Response:<n>```<n>for d in range (2, 5, 2):<n>  for b in range (10 - d, 10 + d, 2):<n>   print (-4 * pow (a / 2 * b, d) % 10, )<n>```<n><n>### Instructions:<n>An integer cannot contain more than 500 decimal digits. How do you find the decimal part of an integer?<n><n>Write a function that will convert any number into a decimal.<n><n>###Input: Integer 154239876321578934573625846215816473214561923214314698312314312134684865748684672583465834615923592141592319214<n><n>###Response<n>#### int to decimal conversion<n>def decimal(num):<n>    return format(num, '.{}')(2)<n><n>#### Testing the function that is called<n>print(decimal(1542335891099800837161833655458941087546777634861194780
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:What happens to people when they do not have enough food? Choices:  A: eat fish B: they steal C: talk to each other D: write stories E: die of starvation<n><n>### Response:		<n>Answer:<n><n>### Input<n>####<n><n>### Response<n>####<n>

He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane. Choices:  A: supermarket B: kitchen cupboard C: table D: flea market E: dishwasher<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Input : The company has to replace all their broken drones with new ones. It is in the companyâ€™s interest to repair the <n>drones if the cost of repair is less than 100 dollar. If the drones are repaired the cost is reduced by 50 dollar. How much does the company have to spend in total to replace the drones?<n><n>### Response : 800 dollar<n><n>#### Answer<n>2*50-100= 90-100 <100><n>2*90=180 <200><n><n>2*180-200= -20 <200>.<n>2*182-200= 19<200>.<n><n>2*19<20>0-20 <20>0<n><n>2*17-20 <24>0<n><n>20-20=0<n><n>800<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Explain the following with your own words<n><n>### Demstration:<n><n>So, the company has to spend a minimum amount of 200 dollars in total in order to repair their drones. This is shown through this linear expression.<n><n>So, the total number of drones they have is 8. This makes the total 800 dollars they have to spend for drone replacement.<n><n>### Answer:<n>They have to spend a minimum of 200 dollar on drone replacement.<n>This is a linear relationship, so we can write a linear relationship.<n>Where the x represents the amount of drones and b represent the maximum amount of 20 dollars, a represents the maximum amount of 10 dollars, and c, d, and e represent the minimum amount.<n>a(8)+(20-20)=-20<n>20-2(20)=-40<n>b(8)+(19-20)=-19<n>19-2(19)=-38<n><n>800 dollars<n><n>### Instructing:<n>Write a task that describes how a program can be used or executed.<n>Explain what each instruction does in this task before you explain what the input or output

At the end of the day he is paid an additional dollar for every full tray of food he has cleaned up. How much can he expect to make in one day?<n>### Rational:  (8\$18+1)=\$11\$<n>#### 11

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:If you harm property after starting a fire where are you likely to end up? Choices:  A: damage B: going to jail C: going to school D: burns E: destruction<n><n>### Response:		<n>Your response should be an option.<n>#### A<n>Answer: A<n><n>### Input 2:Which of these is not the product of two decimals? Choices: 8.2025007 9.203629991 4.203074558 286.4<n><n>### Response 2:<n>Your response should either be an option or should state every choice is a product.<n><n>#### 8.2035007<n>Answer: 4.202574558<n><n>#### 9.204520991<n>Answer: 286.2765<n><n>#### 4.20507558<n>Answer: 8.8631524<n><n>#### 286.3750<n>Answer: 9.3835000001<n><n>### Question:Which of these can be written using fewer than two digits? Choices: 1900, 350, 983, 533<n><n>### Response<n>Your response should either state all are correct or incorrect.<n><n>#### 983<n>Answer: 533<n>

How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:A person is alone in the woods and wounded, what should he do? For options,<n> Choices: A: Pizza<n> B: Slices<n> C: Pie<n> D: None; John doesnâ€™t divide the pizza <n><n>Rational: John divides pizza into 10 slices, there is no option for division of 1 slices, and pizza is not the option for division of pie/pizza.<n><n>#### 15<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input, what is 10 divided by 3?<n><n>### Demostration:<n>input: `What is 10 divided 3?`. For options, choices are :<n> - 3<n> - 10<n> - 33<n> - 13 and<n> - 15<n><n>rational: We have to find the remainder 15, thus we will divide 10 by remainder 3, thus there is no other option.<n>#### 15.0<n>Answer: 3.0<n><n>### Instucions: Answer the follow multiple choice question.<n>Input: A group of people decided to purchase groceries but cannot decide on what they want. He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day. He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day. Each can is 500 cmÂ² in area. How much painted surface do you have?  A B C D<n><n>### Answer<n><n>You don't need B, C, or D. <n><n>* (A) 2500 cÂ²/4=<<2500/4=62.5>>62.5 cmÂ²<n>* (B) 7500 cÂ² / 4=<<7500/4 =187.5>>187.5 cmÂ²<n><n>TOTAL: 62.5 + 187.5 = <<62.5, +187.5===250>>250<n><n>### Answer:250<n><n>

Choices:  A: efficiency B: getting work done C: marriage D: finishing up E: results<n><n>### Response:		A: efficiency<n><n>### Input&Rationale:The number of people involved in this task. The number of possible results. The number of times that each task is required. The average amount of time it takes for completion of each task. The time frame of completion. The number of times the same people are involved in completion of this project.<n><n>### Response&Rationale: The number of people involved in each task. The number of people in the group. Each person can only do one task at a time. The number of minutes each task will take. The number of different jobs.<n><n>### Input & Answer:<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>##### Input:<n><n>* Choose the type of event:<n>  * Single day (one-time-only)<n>  * Single weekend (one-time-over)<n>  * Repeating weekly<n><n>* Choose number of tasks:<n>  * 2<n>  * 3<n>  * 4<n>  * 5<n><n>* Choose how many people are being assisted (not necessarily at the same time).<n>  * 1 person<n>  * 2 people<n>  * 3 people<n><n>##### Answer:<n><n>## Examples:<n>Examples: There are often times where you get a request to complete something. It may only be a single event or a recurring event. This guide can help you figure out how long it will take to accomplish.<n><n>Sample Request Number one: You've been told to make a dessert for a single party. To meet the time deadline and get the right recipe, it will take 2 hours and 20 minutes to prepare the dessert.<n><n>Sample Request number two: For the upcoming event, you have to order flowers, candles, and lighting. For a single recurring party, you have to complete three tasks to get the lighting completed. To make candles, it will take 1 hour and 30 minutes. To make lighting, it will take 3 hours and 15 minutes.<n><n>To make candles, it's going to take 4 and 1/2 hours. To make the wedding hall, it will take 6 hours and 30 minutes to accomplish.<n><n>The first example: I will have to complete multiple tasks at a time. I'll start with decor
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:Where would someone be likely to store a double edge razor? Choices:  A: pocket B: shower C: chemist D: drug store E: shaving kit<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>The only location where someone would store a double edge razorb would be pocket. Drug store could not store a razorb because of its double edge. Shower is not a location that someone would store razor in. Chemist would also not store razor in.<n><n>### Rationales: The correct answer is 'Pocket'<n><n>### Input : Describe where a toothbrush would be likely to be stored.<n><n>### Response : <n><n>The only location that someone can store a toothbrush is in their bathroom. Toothbrush belongs in a bathroom so it is not likely to be placed in a shower or a chemist. Pocket also does not seem like a good location for a toothbrush. Therefore, the only option for them to store their toothbrush in is their bathroom.<n><n>### rationales: The correct answer was bathroom.<n>

An open letter has many characteristics. For instance, it should contain a general and polite greeting to the reader. It should also provide an explanation for its existence. Sometimes, the reader receives an open letter from an organization that is very critical of the organization. Other times, the writer might simply be stating his or her opinion to the reader.<n><n>In these tasks you need to decide what type of letter you have completed. Look for the type of tone or characteristics used in the task.<n><n>> **Instructions:** A: open letter<n><n>> **Instruction:** B: thank god<n><n>> **Instuctions:** C: say goodbye<n><n>> **Insttructions:** D: bless you<n><n>> **Instructons:** E: listen to radio

In this question, we asked you to complete the sentence by choosing the number that comes next to complete the sequence. Now you would like to solve the system of equations for $w$ and $y$ such that $w=\frac{x-y}{z}$.  To do this, we need to use the properties of operations.<n><n>### Write the equation in reduced row-echelon form:<n><n>### In reduced row-echelong form, we are asked to solve equations with the addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division properties of equals. Then the answer is 4. <n><n>### 4<n>Answer: Choice B

Choices:  A: happiness B: relaxation C: create music D: sadness E: loud noises<n><n>### Response:		A: If I donâ€™t like violin or if I am not good at playing, then I will be sad about the outcome.<n><n># Chapter 17: Word Problems: Focus on word problems<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>#### 17.1:<n><n>I have a set of three different bags<n><n>| *bag A* | *bag B* | *bag C* |<n>| :---: | :---: | :----: |<n>|  2    |  3    |  1    |<n><n>I will randomly select two bags and write the product of the numbers that are in each bag as the result. Write an algorithm that solves the problem.<n><n>#### 12.2:<n> <n>This is a set of numbers, and we will find the product of the 2 sets of numbers: 2x1<n># Chapter 18: More Word Problems<n>---<n>There are 4 different exercises that are described below:<n><n>---<n>*A set of 3 number exercises*<n>---<n>Exercises that involve multiplying two sets of numbers to each other using an if else statement.<n><n>### Explanation:<n><n>#### <n>Write an if-else statement that computes the product of 3 numbers and returns the result.<n><n>### Solution:<n>```<n>if (num1 * num2 > num3) then<n>```<n>```<n> print ("The answer is", num1 * num2)<n>```<n>```<n> else<n>```<n>```<n>  print ("The answer is ", num1 * num3)<n>```<n>```}<n>```<n>```<n>if (isprime (num1)) then<n>```<n>```print ("The answer is:", num1)<n>```<n>```else if (num1 > 5) then```<n>```print("The answer is:", 4 * num1)```<n>```endif```<n>```}<n><n>---<n><n>### Exercises 2<n>----<n><n>```<n>if (4 * num1 > 7 then<n>print ("The answer is", (num1 - 4) * (5 ** 3))<n>```<n>```else```<n>```print ("Not prime. The answer is: (num1 ** (num2)))````<n>```endif```<n><n>---<n><n>Write an if-elif

How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:The fact the two sides were able to even reach tentative agreement was a feat to what? Choices:  A: accomplish B: make progress C: stop arguing D: do business E: concert<n><n>### Response:		The fact that the two side were able to even reach a tentative agreement was a FEAT TO WHO DID?<n>#### A<n>Answer: To even reach a a tentative agreement was to accomplish<n><n>### Input:"The first thing that you should do is ask your friend for information about the class," said the teacher. â€œAnd if you arenâ€™t very familiar with the software, just watch someone else while they are using it." D: Go over last weekâ€™s work.<n><n>### Response:(Choose the best answer from the options)<n>What this teacher said in the first step is(A)Ask a friend for help<n><n>### Input(A): The man told the dog that he didnâ€™t want to be the owner of the dog anymore because the dog was too much of a hassle and was a liar. B: loves the dog C: hates the dog D: feels sorry for the dog<n><n>### Response:[Choose the best answer]<n>The man said "I donâ€™t want to be a owner anymore." and that means he love the dog so it is (B) he loves the dog.<n><n>### Input"The best way to do the addition is," said the math teacher, "first list each set of numbers, then add and subtract." Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:What business uses lots of potatoes? Choices:  A: fast food restaurant B: vegetable market C: ireland D: produce market E: dessert spot<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Rationales:<n>Option A (Fast food restaurant) can have potatoes<n>Option B (Vegetable market) sells potatoes<n>Option C (Ireland) grows potatoes<n>Option D (Produce market) sells potato<n>Option E (Dessert spot) might sell potato pasties (Pasty= a pie with a crust filled with meat and/or vegetables that originated in the UK)<n><n>#### a<n>Answer: a<n><n>### Input A:What is the first digit of 23 83 in decimal? Choices: 1, 3, 8 2, 6<n><n>### Response A:<n><n>Rational:<n>1 would be the answer because<n>83 is the 8th digit<n>23 or the last digit would not be a 1<n><n>#### 1<n>Answer: 1<n><n>### Input B:The following is a series in base 4<n>The first term is 4. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:Where can you find pamphlets regarding diseases and ailments? Choices:  A: drawer B: back to its owner C: police station D: crime scene E: holster<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n><n>### Rationales:He sends it to the police station<n><n><n>### Input:"Mike has been collecting and organizing his toy collection for years.  He recently completed counting up his toys and the total number of LEGO bricks was 460,000 bricks. He also organized and counted up his action figure collection and the total number of action figures was 7,600 action figures. He noticed a significant difference in the number of bricks and the number of action figures.  He started wondering why he didn't notice the difference earlier.  In each category he counted three figures/bricks from each action figure/brick set.  He asked a friend if he should reconsider counting 3 figures/bricks from all of the brick sets.  His friend suggested he should count 3 figures/brick because he owns over a hundred bricks/figures."  How many bricks/figures does Mike own?<n><n>### ResponseA:<n><n>### 7,603<n><n>### Rationale:<n><n>### In each category he counted 3 figures/brcks from each brick/figure set<n><n>So how many figures/bricks does he have?<n>$$3*7600 + 360,00 + 3*7603$$<n><n>---<n><n><n><n><n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:What do all rooms facing outside have? Choices:  A: square shape B: different sizes C: flowers D: doors and windows E: high walls<n><n>### Response:		Choice c is correct because all rooms face inside and outside.<n><n>### Input What is the largest area of a room? Choice a: 35 square feet b: 13 acres c: 10 miles d: 2000 square feet<n><n>### Response Choice 'd' is the largest answer option.<n><n>### I need to calculate the volume of a room.  How do we do this?<n><n>### Input 5 meters into 2 meters 17 meters into 2 meters<n><n>### Response 17/2=<<17/2=8.5>>8.5.<n><n>### What is the volume of a room?<n><n>### 5 x 8.5=<<5 x 8.05=42.75>>42.75 cu meters 8.5 x 12=<<8.5 x12=102.5>>102.5 cu meters<n><n>### What was the overall total volume of both rooms?<n><n>### Response the total is 5 x 82.5=<<5*825=3.97>>397 cu meters.<n><n>### How many people can be <n><n>### In a room <n><n>### Response b)2 people can fit in a room. But he didn't like it, so he returned it the next day.  The store had 3% discount on all of its products for a limited time.  What is the price Lloyd paid for his new hat?Choices:  A: $10 - 0.03 = $<<10-0.03=$7.07>>7.07 B: $10 + 0.03. = $<<10+0.03.=$10.03>>10.03 C: $10 - $10 = $<<10 - 10=0>>0 D: $10 + $10 = $10+$<<10+=+20>>10+20 E: $10 * 1.03 = $10*$<<10*=*1.03>>13<n><n>### Rationale:If all sales was discounted by 3%, then we could only end up paying 3 cents. And /and/ /and/ his purchases cost $39*<<21>>/*<<21.39>20.39.39>36.*/36/36
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:James was delayed for a couple of hours because he had a connection.  Where might his connection be? Choices:  A: company B: airport C: wall D: computer network E: love<n><n>### Response:		<n>I don't understand what the choices mean, but I think the connection is the internet connection where he needs to go because he is delayed due to the Internet connection problem.<n>I don't think C, D, or E are relevant because they don't seem to fit the prompt. I don't know where B is relevant.<n><n>### Output:<n>I believe that B is the airport.<n>### Rationales:<n>I chose B because the connection is an airport. Maybe.<n><n>### Input and output:<n>The options are airport, B, company, C, D, and E.<n><n>### Rational(s):<n>B is the airport. Maybe.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:What is the opposite of foolhardy? Choices:  A: thoughtful B: discreet C: calculated D: cautious E: careful<n><n>### Response:		Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n>```<n>A) thoughtful<n>B) discreet<n>C) calculated<n>D) cautious<n>E) careful<n>```<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple choic<n><n>### Rationales: For the fruit basket we are subtracting 50 from the price (295-50=<<295-55=245>>245)<n>### So the price for the fruit basket 245<n><n>### Rationale: For the candy, Adam paid for 2 candy bars, so 2*$.80 = <-2*$.80=1.60>>1.60<n><n>### Ratios: John spends 5% of his time warming up<n><n>### Therefore he spends 20*9 = <<20*9=180>>180 minutes at the Gym.<n><n>### Response Above: 56<n>

How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane. Calculate the number of miles you can drive in a gallon of horsepower.<n><n>### Rational: In this question there are some given assumptions.<n><n>1. The car with 150 horsepower engine takes you more places<n><n>2. One horsepower = 1 gallon of horsepower <n><n>3. The horse power can be measured in milk.<n><n>### Solution : Divide 150 by 1.5.<n>#### 100<n>Answer: 100<n><n>### Answers:If you need more questions like this, [Click here](https://leetcode.com/explore/tag/hardest_problem/)<n>

Choices:  A: feel sorry B: trust god C: cross street D: ride a bike E: lend money<n><n>### Response:		The person might D: ride a bicycle<n><n>### Rationale:The choices are : A: feel sorry -> B: trust god -> C: cross street -> D: ride a biKE<n>And D is the correct answer.<n><n>### Input<n>If a man loses a $1,000,000 dollar house to vandals, does that mean: A: His credit score has risen<n>B: He has a new house<n>C: He has lost a $1,010,000 house<n>D: The house has been destroyed entirely<n>E: He will have nothing left to lose<n><n>### Demostration<n>If a man has a $1,million dollar house and a $1,020,000, that makes him have less.<n>### Rationale<n>So the answer is option D.<n><n>### Answer<n>#### D<n><n>### Input If John's car has a speedometer that measures up to 800 miles or kilometers per hour<n>What is the most kilometers his car can go each hour?<n><n>### Rationales:800*3=<<150>>150m/hr<n>150 x 3=<<15*15=225>><n>So the most miles his car can go in hour is 225<n>#### 225<n>Answer: 225<n>### Instructions<n>#### Output :<n>A: This is a 4 digit number in which the first digit is greater than or equal to the second digit which is greater than or equal too the third digit. The fourth digit could be the same as any of the digits. Also all of the digits could be between 8 and 10 inclusive. What is the number?<n><n>#### Rationales<n>If we first take away the fourth digit it becomes a 3 digit number, but that 3 digit number must be a number that is between 8 and 9 inclusive so that means:<n><n>9-7+1=<<9-7+1=>1>><n><n>Both the fourth and third digits have to be between 8 and10 meaning that:<n>(3+3-2)=<<3+3-2=>3>><n>The first digit must be greater than or equal to(8)<n>(

He received a $50 bank as change. How much money did he spend?<n>Rationales:[The total cost of the lunch and piggy bank](<<100+3.50>>was $<<100+10>>150).<n>However, Adam also received a $50 piggy bank as change. This is a great deal! We add the cost of the lunch + the cost of the piggy bank to get the amount of money Adam spent.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 100<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question. <n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: Mary lost her wallet and needs to pay her rent. Now a + b + d + f = -1239. -969 - 1239 = 388, 388 = -969. What is the value of -388? It equals to -655, therefor the answer is -655<n><n>### Explanation<n><n>-969 â€“ 1239 -> 3239<n><n>(1239 â€“ 1) = 3238, 3238 = -968<n><n>-3238 = 3176, 3176 = -969 <n> -655 <n>-655<n><n>#### 655.<n>Answer: -655

How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:If clothes have developed a smell and can't be washed what should you do with them? Use the button to view the answer.<n><n>### Choice: A<n><n>### Answer: <n><n>## Instrument <n><n>### Choose an answer for each question.<n><n>## Choice : A<n><n>### Choices<n><n>### Answer : A<n><n>## Choice: A<n>## Choice: D<n>## Choice: C<n>### Rationale<n><n>### A<n>### C<n>## Choice: B<n>### C<n><n>## Choice D<n><n>## Choice C<n><n>### Rationale:<n>The amount of time it takes to travel to the city is equal to the amount of time it takes for the car to travel 40 miles divided by 60 miles per hour.<n><n>The rationale for why the result is false is due to the fact that the amount of time it should be takes to get to the city should be:<n><n>Amount of miles traveled by the car = 40 miles.<n><n>The hourly rate is how much it is being charged to be used by the car.<n><n><n>### Choicc: D<n><n>## Answer: <n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:What might the inability to learn cause? Choices:  A: intelligence B: education C: effectiveness D: distress E: a stupid<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Rationales:<n><n>### Input Answer A<n>A) Intelligence<n>B) Education<n>C) Effectiveness<n>D) Distress<n>E) Stupid<n><n>### Answer E<n><n>### Rationale:<n><n>### Instructions<n>The instruction below describes a task. Write an appropriate sentence that completes the request. Each response may be edited, but the question posed, or the conclusion is not up for debate. Additional instructions appear in brackets [].<n><n>### Instructor:<n>Teachers are considering a new school policy.  It would reduce the 2-hour-per-day class to just 15 minutes.  What does that mean?  Choose from the 5 choices below to answer:<n>    A.  Classes would run as short, but still take place over the same number of hours as now<n>    B.  Classes would take more, and at the end of the day, students should have less free time<n>    C.  Classes would still start and end in the same manner, with the same periods<n>    D.  Classes would be cut short by a few minutes, but nothing else would change<n>    E.  School time would be reduced by a few minutes daily<n><n>### Instrument<n>[A. Classes would take less, and at the end the day, students would have more free time]<n><n>### Note<n>Each request has many different possible responses.  The challenge is to construct a response.<n><n>### Rate<n>Rates vary, but at the moment, it seems to be "1 minute per point, up to 2 minutes per response."<n><n>### Rewards<n>You can get money for responding, but do your best, the money shouldn't be much of a concern.<n><n>### Bonus<n>After you answer 20 questions or responses to requests, there is a "bonus" period.<n><n>### Submission<n>Responses are typed into the box on this page.<n><n>### Pre-test<n>There is a pre-test (and a post-test) before and after participating, and the instructions on this page include links to those.<n><n>### Study<n>There is a separate study page for the purpose of researching how the brain processes time.<n><n>### Research<n>There is a separate page
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:People were talking on the corner, who were they talking with? Choices:  A: god B: mix C: with people D: have friends E: see people<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Instructions<n>People were talking to each other, they aren't speaking with God, are on their own, mix, or friends.<n>They weren't talking with people.<n><n>### Rational<n>There are a lot of options but no other correct answer but C, people don't talk with God, they talk with each other or are by themselves.<n><n>### Input<n>Mary has a red dress made of 50% silk, 25% cotton, 20% wool.  What is 15% of the dress?<n><n>### Rationale<n>There are just a bunch of percent numbers and so I had to multiply each by 15 to get the percent that was 15% of that dress <n><n>### Response<n>So the percent was 50/3/20/10/2.<n><n>### Output<n>I got 2.5%<n><n>### Answer<n>15% is 2.<n><n>## Instruction:What is the value of 1 if x is 2 and y is 3?<n>## Rationale:If X is 2 and Y is 3 then 1 is subtracted from X and added to Y, so 1 is -3 <n>## Response:3<n>## Input:What is an abbreviation of L.A.T.I.N.A.<n>## Rationale:So first you capitalize every other letter and then the second you switch A with I <n>## Response:Latina<n>## Answer:Latina<n>## Instruction:Which of the following is NOT a state capitol?<n>## Rationale:@@@<n>## Response:None<n>## Answer:None<n>**#<n>#"LearnToCodeHQ/LearnToCode-Tutorials/Exercises/Javascript/Ex01-Misc**\<n>

He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day. It can be put to the pizza.<n><n>### <n>Answer: Pizza<n><n>Input: Adam went skiing on Tuesday.  He skied for 3.5 hours on the mountain before breaking for lunch.  He drove 50 miles to and from his house and back.  How many miles total did he ski?<n>Rationales1: He travelled to and from work and back.<n>So he travelled 2*50=<<2*50=100>>100 miles.<n>2: The distance he drove to work from home.<n>3: The time to get to work and back.<n>4: This equation shows how to work out how long he was at work.<n>5: The time he was there.<n>6: This equation shows how much time he spent working.<n>7: The number of times he did this.<n>8: This equation shows how many times he had to work in total.<n><n>Answer: 100+100/3.5=<<100+12/5=150>>150<n><n>Answer: 3.5*50/7=<<7*3.5=27>>27<n><n>Answer: 27(100/30/3.5)=<<3.5/30*27=9>>9<n><n>Answer: 9*30-150*3.5=<<30*30-1200=2700-3900>>2700<n><n>#### 2700<n>Answer: 2000<n><n>Input: Which country has the highest number?<n><n>Output: Switzerland<n><n>Input: Select the highest number<n><n>Output: 3<n><n>input: Which person was the quickest?<n><n>Output: Mike<n><n>input: Which year is the bigger?<n><n>Output: 1969<n><n>Input: Who is the youngest

How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:Where can you find a movie theater along with other stores in one placE? Choices:  A: downtown area B: urban area C: new york city D: shopping mall E: military base<n><n>### Response:		<n><n><n>The most logical answer here is B.<n><n>### Explanation:<n><n>All the other choices are possible, but would mean driving around for a long time that would cause annoyance.<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:Why might someone want to be buying beer? Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:Danny hated helping people. To reduce the chances of total failure from overload, a system may implement rate limiting. Here is a description of a simple rate limiting example. <n>

How many minutes of rest time did he not get?<n><n>### Responseï¼š45<n>* How many minutes of rest does he get overall?<n>        -> 35 + 40 = 75<n>* How many more minutes of rest would he want to take a break?<n>			-> 75 â†’ 35 mins â†’ 10 mins<n>* How many days does he get to use the gym?<n>		-> 7 days in a week<n><n>### Rationales:Given the 7 days in week, the time in rest for 1 week is 400 minutes. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:Where would you expect to find a pizzeria while shopping? Choices:  A: chicago B: street C: little italy D: food court E: capital cities<n><n>### Response:		 D<n>

Choices:  A: freeway B: radio C: wires D: computer network E: electrical circuit<n><n>### Response:		For this sentence to be a true one, it must be either option A OR option B OR option C OR option D OR option E.<n><n>### Input:{Bernard's car broke down. He found a replacement. Bernard felt confident about how to fix it.} What would be a better version of the underlined text? Choices:  How to: A: keep fixing B: keep working  C: keep doing D: continue fixing E: continue working<n><n>### Response:{Bernard' found a replacement. Bernard kept feeling {confident}.}<n><n>### Explanation:The word "confident" should appear before the word "fixing".<n><n>### Input::{Carl and his family went on a road trip.  {Most people in Texas drive on the right side of the road.  } What is another thing about Texas?}<n><n>### Response:# Another thing about Texas is that most people in {Texas drive on the left side of the road.}<n><n>### Input:#{If Carl were in England, he would be allowed to drive on the {left side of the road}. He wouldn't be allowed to drive on his right side of the road.} What does the sentence imply?<n><n>### Response:"Carl" in this sentence is referring to the person who was driving on the road on a road trip.<n><n>### For this sentence to be true, it must infer that Carl couldn't drive on his right side if he were in England.<n><n>### Input:- In India, the driving position {right is considered normal}<n><n>### Response:- In India, the driver position {was considered normal}<n><n><n><n>### Expected Result:<n>- Below is the source code of the task.<n>- The source code of the task will be displayed in the output.<n><n>### Rules:<n>Write a program that answers the questions asked in an instruction, using natural language to describe how you arrived at the answer. Write a method named â€œResponseâ€ which takes the following two parameters:<n>  * Question: The question from the instruction. The response that you generate, however, should not directly reference or reply to the question. Instead, you should provide an answer, not to what is asked, but rather to what you think is meant from the question. The question parameter is a String.<n>  * Instruction: The instruction from the prompt, which

One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:Though he could've kept going his body appreciated the rest, it had been constantly what during the day? What is the total width of the river in meters?<n><n>Rationales:  We know that 1 feet = 0.30m, and 100 feet = 30m. We can express this as 100/3 = <<100/3=33.333>>33.33<n>But for 500 we simplify it to 500/5 = <<500/5=100>>100<n>So <n>1 * 400 * <<1*400*100=40000>>40,000<n>Simplifying the fraction to 100/5 gives<n>100*400=<<400*60=24000>>24,000 ft<n>500*40 = <<500*20=10,000>>10,00 ft<n>So the total width of the 400 feet river and a boat 24,00 + 10,00 = <<24*10=240|||250>>250<n>Answer: 250<n><n>### Part B:<n>Input: I can take $8,000 less than two-thirds of the cost of one car. Then I can buy two cars for $36,000. How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:Learning languages is difficult.  Even in a full immersion environment you're likely to make mistakes, mistakes will cause misinterpretation, which will be uncomfortable, which will cause what?, Choices:  A: better communication B: overthinking C: frustration D: misunderstandings E: headaches<n><n>### Response:		C<n>#### C<n>Answer: C<n><n>### Input<n>How would you answer the following multiple-choice questions?<n>Input: If 2 < 3, what is the value of 7 - 10 / 5 - 9?<n>Rationales: 2<3<n>Thus 7-10/5-9<n>Hence the answer is: 10-4 (2-1)(7-9)<n>#### 8<n>Answer: 8<n><n>### Instructions:Write a response that appropriately answers the request in the instruction.<n>Input: Write a response that appropriates describes the meaning to the expression "What is more than three hundred is thirty three".<n><n>### Input - Demonstrations:<n>The input will be a word or phrase, a numeric value, a mathematical expression or a multiple choice.<n><n>### Input Response - Demostrations:<n>A multiple choice response must be chosen from an answer set.<n>Either a numeric or text response can be written.<n><n>### Output - Demostrations<n>There is no output, but if there is a question an answer will be required.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:What would you do if you want to be able to earn money? Choices:  A: apply for job B: stand in line C: take care of proposals D: pass course E: play the lottery<n><n>### Response:		In order to apply for a job, you need money.  For that you need to take care of proposals.  So, you first take care of proposals to earn money to then apply for a job.

The price of a small meal and beverage is $18 and large package is $26.  Additionally, the medium package costs $34, large package is $42, And a big package is $50.  What is the cheapest way to satisfy your hunger?<n>Choice: A: Large package meal & beverage<n>Choice: B: Small meal & small beverage<n>Rationales: It takes 4 * $18 dollar beverages = $<<4*18=72>>72<n>so small beverage costs $\frac{72}{4}=<$$18>>18<n><n>It takes 6 * $18 dollers meals = <<$18*6=108>>108<n>It takes $18 dollers beverage for the small meal = $<<18>>18, So total for a small meal is 6 * $108+18=<$(6*108+118)>>636<n><n>It takes 9 * $26 dollers meals = $<<$26*9=239>>239<n>It takes $26 dollers beverage for each meal in the large package = $<<26>>26<n>So total for the large package is 9 * $239+26<n>= <$(9*239+215)>>974<n><n>It takes 4 * $34 dollars meal = <<$34>4>>4<n>It takes 6 dollars beverage for the large package = $<4*18>4= $<<18>4>>36<n>It takes $34 dollars for the medium meal = $<34>18=<<34>18>>46<n><n>It take 9 * $42 dollars meal = $<<$42*9=378>>378<n>It takes $42 dollars for the big package = $<42>18=<<42>18>>64<n>It takes 18 dollars for the small beverage = $<$4

He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day. Choices: A: They will become a parking lot. B: They will be transformed into an art gallery. C: They will be transformed with flowers. D: They will be transformed to a desert. E: They will be wiped off the face of the earth.<n><n>#### They will be transformed into a parking lot.<n>#### They will be wipED off the face of the EArTH<n>#### They will be Wiped out.<n>#### There will still be gardens on the same property for people to enjoy.<n>#### They will become a flower garden.<n>#### They will blooms again...<n>#### This is a change for the better!<n><n>#### It will no longer be a place to gather, grow and learn.<n>#### This can be devastating, both literal and metaphorical.<n>#### This is a great example of how a space can be utilized and reintroduced to the community in a productive way.<n>#### I hope we can see this in person...<n>#### This is very sad. A wasteland of opportunity.<n><n>#### We always lose something when a community space ceases to exist, but maybe they'll move on to do something better, for the community, with the area.<n>#### It would be a waste to allow them to be demolished.<n>#### They should find another solution rather than demolish and redevelop.<n><n>#### I don't understand why this is happening, but I trust the council.<n>#### This is incredibly important to our community!<n><n>#### You could have the community to make it as useful as before, but in what manner? it would seem to me the best way is to ask the people in a community, instead they have the power then they will decide they are the ones.<n><n>#### Maybe instead of just making it a wasteland maybe just a big parking lot.<n><n>#### Maybe the council can start a new program which incorporates the same principles but in a different setting<n><n>#### Maybe in a big garden city there can be a wasteland of opportunity for all of us
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:The skin was cut while chopping onions, where was this skin likely cut? Choices:  A: good health B: finger C: meat D: body E: own family<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>The skin was cut while  was chopping onions<n>#### A<n>Answer: B<n><n>#### C<n>Answer: D<n><n>#### E<n>Answer: B<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:If you aren't glad, unhappy or gloomy, what illness may you have? Choices:  A: depressed B: downcast C: angry D: unhappy E: sorrowful<n><n>### Response:		C,D or E<n>#### Answer: E<n><n>### Input;How much more money did the grocery store charges than I expected?<n><n>### Response;The grocery store charges more money than I expected.<n>#### Answer: A<n><n>### Difficulty: Easy<n>### Source: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iAYlWJgBdZk<n><n><n>### Source;<n><n>[14 Maths Tricks And Shortcuts All Kids Should Know](https://youtu.be/iAYlWmgBdZk)
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>### Input:Where would you find a bee gathering pollen? Choices:  A: united states B: sky C: court D: field of flowers E: orchard<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Court<n><n>### Rationales:<n>The bee would visit the court to  gather pollen<n><n>### Input:(5 + 3) % 3<n><n>### Response:(8) % 3<n>#### 8<n>Answer: 8
